With Forces ●●●, the mage can use this spell with ranged-weapon attacks suchas thrown rocks.

name: Eyes of the Matrix
description:
As the Forces ● Read Matrices spell, except that the mage casts this rote upon another.

If the spell is cast upon a Sleeper, it invokes Disbelief immediately, even if its Duration is less than one scene.

If the target is unwilling, a reflexive and contested Resolve + Gnosis roll is made to resist.
rotePool: Wits or Presence + Occult or Science + Forces

name: Nullify Combustion
description:
Within this spell’s area of effect, the process of combustion simply cannot be initiated.

Bullets cannot be fired, cars do not start and matches will not light. Magics that create combustion subtract the Potency of this spell from their casting rolls, to a minimum of zero. 

With Forces ●●●, the mage can also cause existing sources of combustion to die out. In the case of magical effects, this spell’s Potency is subtracted from the Potency of the effect in question. If the combustion effect is reduced to zero Potency, the source goes out.

name: Alter Frequency
description:
The mage can increase or decrease the frequency of an existing sound, making it sound deeper or higher, as she desires.

Use is not limited to sounds the mage creates herself. She may alter the frequency of any sound within sensory range for the duration, for whatever purpose she desires. Using this spell on others’ voices, or on other sounds that Sleepers expect to recognize, is a good way to make it Improbable.

name: Friction Reduction
description:
The mage reduces the friction (static or kinetic) between two solid objects.

The mage reduces the friction in a given area according to her successes.

Any person walking on that area suffers a –1 penalty to any action that might have required normal friction to be present, whether it’s a Drive roll to keep control of a car or an Athletics roll to walk across the frictionless surface (other rolls may apply per situation). This penalty can be increased by raising the spell’s Potency factors during casting. Characters who fall into objects take damage accordingly.

name: Invoke Password
description:
The mage learns an electronic password or code.

By touching a machine and successfully casting this spell, the mage immediately learns the machine’s password or passcode, if it has one. If the machine has multiple codes, the mage learns the one for the machine’s currently active function.

The caster must still have some means of inputting the code acquired with this spell. If the machine requires an input device (such as a keycard or transmitter) that the mage doesn’t have, then the code itself doesn’t do much good.

name: Aether Net
description: The mage can create a wireless Internet connection or cell phone connection where there is none, allowing such devices to work even in the absence of their normal network(s).

name: Circuit Television
description:
With this spell, the mage can connect a television monitor to any camera that is nearly connected to a network to which the monitor is connected.

This spell is almost always used with a computer connected to the Internet, because many monitoring cameras in the Western world are connected to an intranet that is connected to the Internet.

name: Transmission
description:
The mage can hijack an extant radio signal, transmitting her own words on it and replacing the original transmission.

While this spell gives the caster the ability to replace one signal with another, it doesn’t convey the skill or talent needed to fake a specific transmission. That requires Skills appropriate to the transmission, which could be Expression, Subterfuge and even Science.

The Storyteller decides what roll needs to be made to devise a convincing transmission.

name: Influence Fire
description:
The mage can influence the direction or flow of an existing flame. 

This spell usually causes the fire to exhaust its fuel in the following turn, although if targets are wearing highly flammable clothing, they might catch fire and continue to burn each turn until the fire is put out. 

A single success allows the fire to affect one target. (The mage can send the fire at any target within three yards of its origin per dot of Forces; a mage with Forces ●● can affect a target six yards away.) 

Excess successes affect additional adjacent targets next to one another (this is an exception to the normal rule that disallows aimed spells to affect multiple targets). Targets must each be within three yards in either direction of each other.

name: Invisibility to Machines
description:
The mage becomes undetectable to electronic devices of all kinds.

Although inferior to true Personal Invisibility, this spell is useful in situations where the mage simply doesn’t want to leave traces behind.
rotePool: Wits + Persuasion + Forces (FC) OR Wits + Stealth + Forces (GotV)

name: Influence Electricity
description:
The mage can influence the direction or flow of electricity.

The mage does not directly attack a person or object with this spell; he instead manipulates an existing electrical current, redirecting it toward the target of his choice. The damage inflicted depends entirely on the electrical current. The raw power of the current is not altered in any way at this level.

This spell usually causes the power source to shut down or short out in following turn.  A simple success allows the electricity to affect one target. (The mage can arc the electricity to any target within five yards of the source per dot of Forces; a mage with Forces ●● can affect a target 10 yards away.) Excess successes affect additional adjacent targets next to one another.

name: Light Mastery
description:
The mage can create or extinguish light.

He could cause a room to go pitch-black or light a dark cave from nothing but the tip of a glowing finger.

Successes determine the created light’s intensity (in a directional 30-degree arc).

One success is usually enough to extinguish a light, unless it’s a light created by this spell or other magic, in which case the magic’s Potency must be exceeded by this spell.

name: Supernal Hack
description:
Supernal Hack provides two separate effects.

After casting it, an Awakened computer user can add additional dice equal to the number of dots he has in Forces to any computer-related rolls for the rest of the scene. As well, while Supernal Hack is active, any penalties inflicted by Supernal-security measures on technological devices the mage interacts with are halved.

name: Call Lightning
description:
The mage calls down lightning from a stormy sky to strike a target of his choice.

He cannot conjure lightning from nothing (at least, not at this level). He can bring down lightning only from a pre-existing storm or a storm he causes through the Change Weather spell.

The bolt inflicts three points of bashing damage plus one per success (two successes therefore inflict five points of bashing damage). The target must be somewhere that lightning could reasonably strike.

name: Cutting Scream
description:
The mage focuses the sound of their voice to damage and deafen a single opponent within range of touch.

Each success on the casting inflicts one point of bashing Health damage.

With Forces 4, damage dealt may be improved to lethal, or by spending one Mana with Forces 5, damage dealt amy be improved to aggravated. This spell is treated as a ranged attack. fired at melee range, allowing the target their normal Defense. For each point of damage taken, the target is deafened for one turn, but is allowed a reflexive Stamina check to reduce the number of turns deafened by one per success.

name: Control Fire
description:
The mage can fuel an existing fire, increasing its size and intensity. Likewise, he can deprive an existing fire of fuel, dampening or even extinguishing it.

When fueling a fire, successes are allocated between size and heat, with each success either doubling the fire’s size or adding one point to its heat damage. When dampening a fire, each success subtracts one from the damage it delivers. Once it has no more damage rating, it is extinguished.

name: Telekinetic Strike
description:
The mage creates a ball of telekinetic force that he hurls at his intended target.

Each success inflicts one point of bashing damage.

With Forces ●●●●, this damage can be lethal.

With Forces ●●●●●, one Mana can be spent to make the damage aggravated, by tearing apart the target’s cellular structure. This version of Telekinetic Strike actually causes air to ripple in an unnatural fashion, warning a target about the threat. The target is allowed his Defense against the caster’s aiming roll.

name: Curse of Electrical Rebellion
description:
The mage creates a cursed item that will cause electrical components to short out, malfunction and otherwise stop working in the owner’s presence.

The mage must add five to the target number per point of Mana spent.

Whenever the item’s owner is in proximity to a functioning electronic device, and there is some chance that its malfunction might harm him, or seriously hamper his pursuit of his current goals, the Storyteller rolls a die pool equal to the Mana spent on this spell during item creation. On a success, the device malfunctions. On an exceptional success, the device’s malfunction threatens the owner’s life.

name: Personal Invisibility
description:
The mage can turn herself invisible.

Cast in combination with Sound Mastery, the mage can be invisible and completely silent. She must maintain concentration as an instant action to remain unseen.

One success is enough to hide the mage from sight, while excess successes act to occlude her from spells used to see or locate her (compare spell Potencies). Although the mage’s physical form is invisible, her aura can still be seen by those with the ability to perceive auras.

name: Empowered Voice
description:
The Mage utters any brief word or syllable, which instantly becomes a defeaning thunderclap.

Anyone within the affected area, one-yard centered on the mage is subject to Knockdown effect: the must roll Dex+Athletics to remain on their feet. Characters knocked down to the ground loose their next action as they regain their footing. 

Dramatic Failure indicates that the victim takes a hard fall and suffers a point of bashing damage as well.

name: Stay the Invisible Fires
description:
The mage creates an invisible shield against radiation.

For the Duration, the mage is immune to the effects of harmful radiation and does not become irradiated, although other side effects can cause harm. So the mage could handle plutonium with bare hands without risk, but couldn’t resist the heat of a nuclear reactor.

name: Bestow Unseen Shield
description: The mage casts a protective ward upon others. As with the Forces ●● Unseen Shield spell.
rotePool: Intelligence or Resolve + Occult or Science + Forces

name: Sound Mastery
description:
The mage creates sounds or silences them.

He could, for example, create the sound of a police siren or render absolutely silent the footfalls of a stealthy intruder. He can also record sounds, storing them magically for later playback.

Successes determine the sound’s volume. The range of sounds the mage creates depends on his ingenuity and capability.

name: Instill Shock
description:
The mage weaves a protective measure into an electronic device or other device capable of holding a significant charge of electrical energy. 

Unauthorized individuals touching the device receive a powerful shock.

Shock victims suffer bashing damage equal to the number of Mana spent during item creation.

name: Telekinesis
description:
The mage can telekinetically lift and/or use an object remotely.

The mage must declare before casting whether successes apply to the force’s Strength (its lifting ability) or Dexterity (its fine manipulation ability). The lesser Attribute has a default score of 1 dot. The caster can also raise either Attribute by choosing to suffer a –1 dice penalty on the spellcasting roll per dot to be raised.

The object cannot be moved beyond the mage’s sight (unless he uses Space ●● to scry it). The mage can move the item at a Speed per turn equal to his Gnosis + Forces. The mage must concentrate for each turn (see Concentration). With Forces ●●●●, he can cast the spell with a default Duration of one scene

name: Turn Projectile
description:
The mage can direct the course of a fast projectile.

Although the casting is an instant action, the mage can cast this spell at any point in the Initiative roster, even before he could normally act, although that is his action for the turn. The mage can turn the projectile up, down, right, left, or even back the way it came. The degree to which the projectile’s course is altered depends on the number of successes rolled.

Mages can mix and match successes to direct a projectile’s course in multiple directions. For example, with two successes, a mage can turn an arrow 45 degrees to its left and then make it go down 45 degrees from its new course. The effect is lasting; once the projectile’s course is altered, it remains traveling along its new course until something else causes it to change vectors or it smashes into something. With a successful reflexive Dexterity + Firearms roll, the mage can aim the projectile at a target along its new trajectory.

name: Complex Transmission
description: Similar to Transmission, except the mage can send a complex audiovisual transmission.

name: Control Electricity
description:
The mage can diminish an electrical current and/or alter its direction of flow. 

He cannot increase the current at this level, since that involves generating new electricity. He can work with only existing electricity at this level.

Each success can send a single line of power in a new direction, or divert it elsewhere. If the mage attempts to diminish the power, each success brings it down by one degree. For example, one success reduces a main line to a junction box. Two successes takes a junction box down to an industrial socket. Three successes reduces an industrial socket to a regular wall socket.

name: Autonomous Servant
description:
The mage can have a spell perform an extended-action task for him while he goes about his own business. 

Forces ●●● allows for the accomplishment of one physical extended-action task through telekinesis. Successes are allocated to the telekinetic force’s Strength or Dexterity, as per the “Telekinesis” spell. The caster must concentrate for the length of the task. If he is attacked or surprised, a Resolve + Composure roll must be made for him to maintain concentration. If concentration is lost before the extended action’s target number is reached, the spell can be recast but all accumulated successes are lost; the spell must start from scratch.

The spell’s telekinetic force performs the extended-action task, guided by a portion of the mage’s own mind that is invested into the chore being performed. The dice pool is equal to the telekinesis’ spell’s assigned Attribute plus the mage’s own Skill. A heavy lifting task might require Strength + Athletics, cooking dinner or writing one’s memoirs might need Dexterity + Athletics or Crafts, and picking a lock might be Dexterity + Larceny.

name: Kinetic Ripple
description:
The mage lashes out with her magic, harming anyone near her with a shimmering wave of force. 

This spell causes damage based on target proximity from point of origin (the caster). All targets within a one-yard radius of the mage suffer one point of lethal Health damage per success on the casting roll. All targets outside the one-yard radius, but within three yards of the mage, suffer one point of bashing Health damage per success on the casting roll.

name: Unseen Hand
description:
The mage can telekinetically lift a living creature remotely.

A simple success lifts the target into the air. The spell’s Strength is equal to its successes. The mage can move the living creature at a Speed per turn equal to his Gnosis plus any successes allocated for this purpose. The target cannot be moved beyond the mage’s sight.

Each turn, the victim can attempt to struggle free from the telekinetic grip. It takes an instant action and a Strength + Athletics or Brawl roll, penalized by the spell’s assigned Strength.

With Forces ●●●●●, this spell can have a default Duration of prolonged (one scene), in which case when the caster is not actively manipulating the target, the target stays where the caster left him, even if he levitates in the air.
rotePool: Wits + Brawl + Forces vs. Composure + Gnosis

name: Influence Magnet
description:
The mage can strengthen or weaken any natural magnet or magnetic substance.

Using this spell on a magnetized object, each success on the spell can increase or decrease the magnet’s Strength by one. An object reduced to Strength 0 is still mildly magnetic, but probably not strong enough to support the object’s own weight. One additional success can then reduce a Strength 0 magnet to a completely non-magnetized state.

This spell can also be cast on objects that are not magnetized but can naturally be magnets. The first success then gives the object magnetic Strength 0, and additional successes allow the mage to increase that Strength.

name: Firebolt
description:
This magic allows a willworker to project a lancing gout of flame from his fingertips toward a target at range.

Each success assigned to the Potency of this spell inflicts one Health box of lethal damage to the target, who is allowed to apply her Defense against the attack. With Forces 5, the caster can spend a point of Mana to make this spell inflict aggravated damage.

name: Control Velocity
description:
The mage can increase or decrease the velocity of an object (but not a living creature). 

Although the casting is an instant action, the mage can cast this spell at any point in the Initiative roster, even before he could normally act, although doing so is his action for the turn.

Each success doubles or halves the target object’s speed. For example, a truck going 80 mph is reduced to 40 mph with one success, 20 mph with two successes, 10 mph with three successes, 5 mph with four successes, and two-and-a-half mph with five successes.

name: Burst of Speed
description:
This spell makes a mage swifter than any mortal human being could be, reducing the force of forward friction (from the atmosphere and winds) to nil, while vastly amplifying forward momentum.

A Mana point can be spent to boost Speed for a turn. The caster can do so as many times as he wishes while the spell’s scene-long Duration is still active (assuming he has enough Mana). The mage’s Speed increases by itself again for success on each the spell casting roll.

Characters who run double this figure, as well. Assuming the spell has four successes and a mage has a Speed of 12, he has an effective speed of 48. If he runs, his Speed is 96 — almost 65 miles per hour! If any Sleeper witnesses the mage running faster than a normal human, Disbelief is invoked.

name: Levitation
description:
The mage can lift himself off the ground using telekinetic force. At this level of Forces, travel is slow and requires concentration.

Success allows the mage to levitate and travel in any direction with a maximum Speed equal to her Gnosis +1 per success (she cannot double this as she could by running on the ground). She must maintain concentration as an instant action (no further rolls are required). She is not very maneuverable, however. She cannot make quick movements to dodge obstacles and does not gain her Defense against any attacks that can reach her.

If she is attacked or startled, a reflexive Resolve + Composure roll must be made to maintain concentration.

name: Change Weather
description:
The mage alters weather patterns, bringing almost any sort of normal (non-disastrous) weather to bear on an area, given enough time and effort.

The inertia of current weather patterns might levy dice penalties. Making threatening thunderclouds release a downpour might cause no penalty, while turning a bright summer’s day into freezing rain might cause a –3 dice penalty. It takes about five minutes after casting for the storm effects to develop. Major conditions, such as hurricanes or tornadoes, require the Adverse Weather spell.
rotePool: Intelligence or Resolve + Occult or Sciences + Forces

name: Invisible Fire
description:
The mage strikes a target with a concentrated amount of radiation.

Each success inflicts one level of lethal damage due to radiation burns. Invisible Fire ignores armor not specifically shielded against radiation or magic. Anyone with the protection of Stay the Invisible Fires is immune.

name: Transform Energy
description:
The mage can transform energy: sound into light or heat, or electricity into sound, or fire into electricity, or any combination of these forces.

The existing energy is transformed, but it is not increased or diminished unless cast in combination with a spell that allows that effect. Use the chart below as a general guideline for transforming one form of energy into another:
rotePool: Intelligence or Wits + Occult or Science + Forces

name: Gravity Shift
description:
With each success, the mage can shift the direction of gravity upon his person by 45 degrees.

One success allows him to scale a vertical wall with mild effort, as if it were a steep incline; two successes allows him to walk straight up it as if it was flat ground. Four successes are needed to walk on a ceiling (after walking up the wall to reach it).

name: Fiery Transformation
description:
With this spell, a mage transforms into a creature of living flame.

The spell takes effect in the turn following casting.

Since the mage does not transform into another form of life, she is in no danger of losing herself to an alien mindset. Instead, she becomes a being of fire. Planes of force within her new shape allow her to maintain whatever Physical Attributes she possessed before the change.

The successes rolled for this spell are rolled as dice of lethal damage against anyone or anything not somehow fireproofed that makes physical contact with the mage (including her clothes and equipment). Likewise, the mage’s hand-to-hand attacks cause lethal fire damage, to which the spell’s successes are added as an equipment bonus.

With Forces 5, the caster can spend one Mana to inflict aggravated damage with this magic.

name: Quench the Invisible Fires
description:
This spell cleanses radioactivity from an affected area.

Radioactive materials in the spell’s area are instantly rendered non-radioactive (and therefore useless for any purposes relying on their radioactivity). This includes material irradiated by contact with radioactive materials.

name: Friction Knife
description:
The mage increases the force of friction upon a given subject to the point that contact with the air itself causes lacerations and abrasions.

The subject suffers one Health wound of lethal damage per every three yards (rounding down) that she moves in a turn. At the Storyteller’s discretion, one additional wound might be caused by a strong wind.
rotePool: Intelligence + Occult or Science + Forces vs. Stamina + Gnosis

name: Bestow Invisibility
description:
The mage can turn another person invisible, as he does with himself with the Forces ●●● Personal Invisibility spell. The target must maintain concentration to remain unseen.

The target, not the mage, must concentrate to maintain the effect.

name: Sensory Deprivation
description:
The mage uses Forces to cut a target off from three of his senses: speaking, hearing and seeing.

The addition of Life can stimulate the subject’s biological fear responses (increased heartbeat, sweat, hyperventilating).

The addition of Mind can emotionally urge the subject to feel whatever the caster desires during this time of deprivation.

Each success on the casting roll reduces any Composure-based rolls (including, obviously, Perception rolls) by one. A success also reduces any Manipulation-based rolls (i.e., attempts to communicate) by one die per success, as well.

name: Thunderbolt
description:
The mage conjures up crackling tendrils of electricity that dance between her fingertips, and then sends them at a ranged target.

Each success inflicts one Health wound of lethal damage. With Forces ●●●●●, one Mana can be spent to make the damage aggravated (although the target is allowed his Defense against the aiming roll made for the caster).

name: Electromagnetic Pulse
description:
The mage creates an EMP that destroys power and electrical devices.

One success is sufficient to ruin every electrical device within the spell’s radius (destroying the Structures of all electronic components). (Certain military devices specifically made to resist EMP are immune). A simple success affects a one-yard radius. Excess successes spread the pulse over a larger area.

The effect is lasting, although devices can be repaired.

name: Control Gravity
description:
The mage redirects the force of gravity, causing people and things to fall in another direction, such as sideways or upward.

A simple success affects gravity in a one-yard radius. Excess successes spread the energy over a larger area.
rotePool: Intelligence or Composure + Occult or Science + Forces

name: Concentration or Prolonged
description:
The mage acquires the power of flight, using telekinetic force to repel herself from the surface of the Earth and upward into the air. This is a more advanced version of Forces ●●●● Levitation. 

Success allows the mage to fly and travel in any direction with a maximum Speed equal to her Gnosis +1 per success (she cannot double this as she could by running on the ground). Reflexive Dexterity + Athletics rolls are made to avoid obstacles, and she gains her normal Defense against attacks that can reach her.

If stunned or knocked out, the user does not fall, but slowly floats downward at a rate of Speed equal to her Size, touching ground without injury. If the spell’s Duration expires before she touches down, she falls like anyone dropped from her current hight.

name: Adverse Weather
description:
The mage creates a major weather disturbance such as a tsunami or monsoon, following the guidelines of the "Change Weather" spell.

Creating a tornado in the American Midwest in the summer might impose a –1 dice penalty (depending upon current prevailing weather), while doing so in northern Alaska probably imposes a – 5 dice penalty, regardless of the season.

Long-term weather effects (storms, monsoons) take about five minutes after casting to grow into force, and dissipate as soon as the spell’s Duration expires. Short-term effects arise immediately and disappear immediately when the spell expires.

name: Radiation
description:
The mage irradiates an area, causing it to be suffused with deadly radiation.

The spell’s successes determine the radius. Anything outside that area is not affected.

Living beings cannot spend time in the area without suffering the adverse effects of radiation poisoning. For every 30 minutes a person is exposed, increase the radiation’s Potency by one. Once it exceeds the creature or person’s Stamina, he suffers symptoms of poisoning.

name: Velocity Mastery
description:
The mage can completely control an object or even a living creature’s velocity, causing the subject to speed up or slow down beyond personal control. The mage can even halt bullets in midair.

Although the casting is an instant action, the mage can use this spell at any point in the Initiative roster, even before he could normally act, although doing so is his action for the turn.

This spell acts just like Control Velocity, except that the mage can now cast it on living creatures or even on portions of objects. When the spell is cast on a living creature, its Speed trait is doubled or halved per success. 

In the case of projectiles, one success is enough to completely halt a projectile halfway in its path. Additional successes can halt it closer and closer to its origin point, and an exceptional success can halt a bullet in the barrel of a gun. For instance, with two successes, a bullet is stopped after it travels only one-quarter the way from the barrel to its intended target.

name: Earthquake
description:
With this spell, a mage can create a localized earthquake by manipulating the balance of force and pressure beneath the ground.

This spell inflicts damage upon structures such as buildings within its targeted area equal to the spell’s successes. Dexterity + Athletics, minus the spell’s successes, is rolled for living beings to remain standing.

In uncommon cases, those in the area (especially those who fall down) may suffer a Health wound or two of damage, almost always bashing (Storyteller’s discretion).

Characters who fall into objects take damage normally.

name: Create Sunlight
description:
The mage creates sunlight. He does not really turn night into day, but does create a miniature sun, a source of true sunlight.

The spell’s successes determine the area of direct sunlight; anything outside the area might be illuminated indirectly by the glow, but isn’t otherwise affected.

Needless to say, this spell is especially deadly to vampires. Within the radius affected, the sunlight is “direct” (three points of aggravated damage per turn). Outside the immediate radius (within double the radius’ area), the sunlight is “faint” (one point of aggravated damage per turn).

name: Bestow Burst of Speed
description:
The mage allows others to vastly speed up their movement, as he does for himself with Forces ●●●● Burst of Speed.

The target, not the mage, can spend a Mana point to boost his Speed for a turn, as per the rules for the Burst of Speed spell. If the target has no Mana, he cannot gain the benefit of this spell.

name: Bestow Levitation
description:
The mage can impart levitation to others. This is identical to that which a mage could bestow upon himself with Levitation, although the target must concentrate to levitate.

This spell can be cast upon only willing targets. To lift an unwilling target, the caster must use Unseen Hand.

The target, not the mage, must concentrate to maintain the spell.
rotePool: Intelligence or Wits + Occult or Science + Forces

name: Complete Invisibility
description:
The mage can turn herself invisible, as with the Forces ●●● Personal Invisibility spell, but she no longer needs to maintain concentration to remain unseen.

One success is enough to hide the mage from sight, while excess successes act to occlude her from spells used to see or locate her (compare spell Potencies). Although the mage can now make quick movements (unlike with Personal Invisibility), and gains her Defense against attacks that can actually target her (the attacker must be able to see through the spell’s Potency with a spell of his own), she cannot make Brawl or Weaponry attacks or run or dive for cover without revealing her location. Such movements can be seen as a prominent blur or refraction of light, allowing others to freely target the mage (with a –1 dice penalty) on the turn in which she moves and before she acts again on the following turn.

name: Magnetize
description:
By manipulating an object’s magnetic properties, the mage can turn non-magnetic objects into temporary magnets.

Any object affected by this spell temporarily becomes a magnet. It begins with a Strength of zero; the object is mildly magnetic, but it cannot provide effective resistance against a creature that wants to move the object and may not be able to magnetically support its own weight. The Strength is increased by one per additional success.

name: Increase Gravity
description:
This spell increases the pull of gravity, as if the Earth were a larger body.

A simple success gives gravity a Strength of 1 and affects a five-square yard area. Excess successes are allocated between the Strength of the gravity and the area affected. Each point of Strength subtracts three points from the Speed of anyone or anything within the volume affected. Those affected also suffer a –1 dice penalty to jumping rolls per Strength.

Additionally, if the gravity’s Strength exceeds a person’s Strength, all Physical dice pools are at –1 dice per excess Strength. Flying creatures (including those using Forces spells to fly or that are lifted telekinetically) are subject to a reflexive Strength + Athletics roll each turn. Failure in any roll forces them toward the ground at a rate of Speed per turn equal to the gravity’s Strength.
rotePool: Resolve or Presence + Occult or Science + Forces

name: Eradicate Radiation
description:
The mage extinguishes a source of nuclear radiation in an area.

The intensity of the radioactive source can levy dice penalties. A small amount of uranium might impose no penalty, while a cooling rod from an active nuclear plant might levy a –3 penalty. A simple success affects radiation in a 1-yard radius. Excess successes extinguish radiation over a larger radius.

name: Nullify Gravity
description:
This spell decreases the pull of gravity as if the Earth were a smaller body.

A simple success decreases gravity within a five-cubic yard volume. Successes are allocated between the Potency of the gravity and the volume affected.

name: Counterspell (Life)
description:
• The mage creates Pattern interference to weaken or cancel a Life spell.
  • Mage Sight is required to perceive the attacking spell and counter it.
  • Counterspell can be cast against vulgar spells from mages with higher Initiative.
  • Counterspell can also be used to counter sympathetic spells cast directly at the mage.
  • Successes subtract from the target spell's Potency; if reduced to zero, the spell is canceled.
  • Covert spells require identification before countering, while vulgar spells can be countered immediately.
  • Countering a spell aimed at multiple targets affects all targets.
  • Countering requires at least one dot in an Arcanum used by the attacking spell.

name: Cleanse the Body
description:
• The mage can cleanse herself of drugs, toxins, or poisons.
  • Spellcasting successes provide bonus dice for overcoming a drug.
  • Successes also allow the mage to ignore an equal amount of points of poison damage.

name: Healer's Trance
description:
• The mage can discern the state of health and detect illnesses in a living being.
  • Obscure or rare diseases may impose a dice penalty to the detection roll.
  • Each roll takes one turn, and the target number varies based on the subject's condition.
  • One success is needed to examine a perfectly healthy specimen.
  • More successes may be required to detect small cancerous tumors or other significant illnesses.

name: Forgo Rest
description:
• The mage can temporarily go without sleep without experiencing impairment.
  • Spellcasting successes determine the additional period of time the mage can go without sleep (6 hours per success).
  • No Stamina + Resolve roll is needed during this time.
  • The mage does not suffer penalties for missed sleep during the spell's duration.
  • The maximum duration of the spell is a number of days equal to the lower of the mage's Stamina or Resolve.
  • Once the spell ends, the mage experiences the effects of missed sleep and must make up the lost sleep (additional hour per six-hour period forgone).

name: Pulse of the Living World
description:
• The mage gains Mage Sight, allowing them to detect mystic vital animation and read resonance.
  • Successes in the scrutiny reveal clues about various aspects of the investigated resonance.
  • The Storyteller should make the rolls, sharing information each time a success is rolled.
  • The analysis can yield useful information even if the scrutiny is abandoned before completion.
  • Suggested equipment, such as crystals or gems, can enhance the appearance of resonance.
  • The density of the subject affects the dice pool with corresponding modifiers.
rotePool: Wits or Intelligence + Medicine or Science + Life

name: Sense Life
description:
• The mage gains the ability to sense the proximity of living creatures using an arcane sense.
  • The mage can detect the presence of living creatures within their sensory range.
  • The spell creates a "safety zone" around the mage, within which no living thing can enter without their knowledge.
  • The radius of the safety zone increases with the number of successes achieved.
  • Successes can also be used to pierce supernatural occlusion of a living creature.

name: Analyze Life
description:
• The mage can discern the species, age, and sex of a nearby living plant or animal, including humans.
  • Identifying a specific species requires a reflexive Intelligence + Animal Ken Skill roll.
  • If the target is a plant, Science Skill, Survival Skill, or Medicine Skill is rolled instead.
  • The mage can also discern the breed of an animal.
  • A non-human supernatural creature can be identified if the mage has seen its like before.
  • If the mage hasn't seen the creature before, its species remains unknown.
rotePool: Intelligence + Survival (plants) or Animal Ken (animals) or Medicine + Life

name: Bread Alone
description:
• The mage can turn inedible plant matter and creepy-crawlies into nutritious and easily stored blocks of food.
  • The food created is tasty, but too much of it can become boring.
  • The spell requires base life matter to be available and in hand, such as leaves, slugs, beetles, worms, or cacti.
  • The mage needs to kill the animals or pick the plant matter before casting the spell.
  • Successes are allocated to Potency, with each point of Potency creating enough food for one meal for one person.

name: Transfer Base Features
description:
• The mage can give one base life form features from another base life form.
  • One feature can be transferred per success, like chitinous armor or photosynthetic skin.
  • The mage must touch the target at this level, but with Life ●●●, the spell can be cast at sensory range.
rotePool: Intelligence + Animal Ken or Survival + Life vs. Stamina

name: Control Base Life
description:
• The mage can control base life forms by manipulating their instinctual responses.
  • She can make a base life form engage in any natural behavior, even outside of normal circumstances.
  • The mage can trigger fight or flight responses and compel instinctual behaviors.
  • Manipulation of brain and glandular chemistry is used to achieve these effects.
  • Successes determine the radius of effect, ranging from 1 yard to 16 yards.

name: Transform Base Life
description:
• The mage can transform one base form of life into another base life form.
  • Transmutation requires touching the target, but with Life ●●●, it can be cast at sensory range.
  • The mage can affect a target of Size 20 or less, with penalties for larger targets.
  • Transforming a smaller life form into a larger one incurs dice penalties based on the size increase.
  • The size of an insect swarm resulting from the transformation depends on the size of the original life form.
rotePool: Intelligence or Resolve + Animal Ken or Survival + Life vs. Stamina

name: Visions of the Living World
description:
• The spell is similar to "Life ● Pulse of the Living World," but can be cast on another mage or supernatural being.
  • If cast on a Sleeper, it immediately invokes Disbelief, even with a duration of less than one scene.
  • If the target is unwilling, they can resist with a reflexive and contested Resolve + Gnosis roll.
rotePool: Intelligence or Manipulation + Animal Ken or Survival + Life

name: Organic Resilience
description:
• The mage can strengthen their living Pattern with magic, gaining increased resilience to various forms of attack.
  • The protection doesn't defend against psychic harm or attacks to the mage's spirit.
  • It partially foils attacks from edged weapons, blunt trauma, fire, and other forms of energy.
  • The mage gains one point of armor per dot in the Life Arcanum.
  • The duration can be extended to one day by spending one Mana, and successes help resist attempts to dispel the shield.
  • Note: The magical armor does not protect against grappling or overpowering attempts, which can be countered by other Arcana spells.

name: Heal Flora and Fauna
description:
• The mage can heal wounds of animals and plants.
  • Similar to Self Healing, but can be cast on nonhuman life.
  • Requires touching the target, but with Life ●●●, it can be cast at sensory range.
  • The radius of the healing effect increases with each success:
    • 1 success: 1-yard radius
    • 2 successes: 2-yard radius
    • 3 successes: 4-yard radius
    • 4 successes: 8-yard radius
    • 5 successes: 16-yard radius

name: Body Control
description:
• The mage gains perfect conscious control over bodily functions.
  • Successes provide benefits in four categories:
    • Breathing: Each success allows the mage to halve the oxygen needed without hindering physical activity.
    • Reflexes: Each success adds one to the mage's Initiative.
    • Metabolism: Each success doubles the time before needing to check for deprivation or fatigue.
    • Heartbeat: Each success slows down the heart, increases resistance to poisons, and accelerates healing time for bashing wounds.

name: Self-Purging
description:
• The mage can cure sickness or disease in herself.
  • The required number of successes depends on the rarity and virulence of the disease.
  • A common cold might require three successes, while more severe diseases like Ebola might require 10 or more.
  • This spell does not provide any clues for finding a mundane antidote or cure.

name: Purify Bodies
description:
• The mage can cleanse others of drugs, toxins, or poisons.
  • Similar to the Life ● Cleanse Body spell, but can be cast on others.
  • Requires touching the target, but with Life ●●●, it can be cast at sensory range.

name: Self-Healing
description:
• The mage can heal herself of injuries and wounds.
  • Each success heals one point of bashing or lethal Health damage.
  • Aggravated wounds can be healed with Life ●●●, but the spell is Vulgar.
  • The spell can be cast covertly, but witnesses might require a plausible explanation for the healing.

name: Evidence Shroud
description:
• The mage erases all forensic evidence of activities undertaken during the current scene.
  • This includes hairs, body fluids, fingerprints, footprints, fibers, and more.
  • Security camera footage and recorded media show unusably blurry or distorted images.
  • If cleaning up incriminating materials, all evidence is completely removed.
  • Making a show of mundane cleaning before casting can prevent Disbelief.
  • The spell can be cast as Life-only or Matter-only, targeting organic or inorganic evidence respectively.

name: Control Median Life
description:
• The mage can manipulate an animal's instinctual responses within its normal range of behavior.
  • Through delicate manipulation of brain chemistry and glandular systems, the mage can induce desired reactions.
  • The spell does not create a mental compulsion but utilizes the animal's natural instincts.
  • The mage can affect an animal's emotional state and trigger instincts such as pack hierarchy.
  • One success is sufficient to induce a desired instinctual response.
  • If the animal is strongly determined to perform a different activity, a contested roll may be required.
  • A +1 or greater dice bonus can be added to the contested roll.
rotePool: Presence or Manipulation + Animal Ken + Life

name: Trigger Autonomic Function
description:
• The mage can trigger autonomic bodily functions in the target.
  • Examples include sleep, sneezing, coughing, elimination, arousal/orgasm, and "fight or flight".
  • The spell is simple, physical, and immediate.
  • With Time 2, the spell can be delayed up to an hour.
  • Only physical responses are triggered, not instinctive emotional reactions.
  • Living targets capable of the chosen bodily function can be affected.
  • Undead creatures and supernatural functions are not affected.
  • At the Storyteller's discretion, a "fight or flight" reaction may prompt a test for supernatural functions.

name: Metabolic Suspension
description:
• The spell grants the mage several benefits:
    • The mage does not require sustenance.
    • The mage does not need to breathe.
    • Internal organs cease functioning, providing immunity to non-magical diseases and toxins.
  • The spell does not suspend the aging process.
  • Mundane medical examinations diagnose the mage as dead, but magic still detects their Pattern as living.
  • Mages with higher proficiency in the required Arcana can suspend another's body with an enchanted touch.

name: Healing Heart
description:
• The mage can heal the wounds of other humans.
  • Each success heals one bashing or lethal Health wound.
  • The rightmost wound on the Health chart is healed first.
  • At this level, the mage must touch the target.
  • With Life 4, the mage can heal aggravated wounds, but still needs to touch the target.
  • With Life 5, the mage can heal aggravated wounds at sensory range.

name: Transform Self
description:
• The mage can give himself the features of a base or median life form (most mammals, fish, birds and reptiles).
  • Each success allows the mage to take on one feature of a base or median life form.
  • Possible features include gills, sharp claws, fangs, cat's eyes, or a rat's digestive system.
  • These features are purely biological and do not grant any additional skills or abilities beyond their biological function.
  • The mage must have specimens available during casting to accurately manifest the desired features.

name: Transform Median Life
description:
• The mage can transform one form of median life into another median (most mammals, fish, birds and reptiles) or base life form.
  • The target must be of Size 20 or less.
  • If the target is larger, penalties are applied to the spellcasting roll based on the increase in Size.
  • The target is transformed into a creature of typical Size for the new form.
  • Transforming a smaller creature into a larger creature incurs dice penalties.
  • At this level, the mage must touch the target to cast the spell. With Life 4, he can cast it at sensory range.

name: Organic Shield
description: The mage can cast the Life 2 Organic Resilience spell on other individuals.

name: Enforced Silence
description:
• The mage can silence a target creature's vocalizations, rendering them unable to make any noise with their voice.
  • The spell paralyzes the vocal chords, tongue, and lips, preventing the target from producing sounds louder than breathing.
  • No hisses, tongue clicks, or other vocal noises are possible, and even coughs become barely audible wheezing.
  • The spell can be cast on any living being that generates noise through breathing.
  • The number of targets affected increases with extra successes: 2 targets with 2 successes, 4 targets with 3 successes, 8 targets with 4 successes, and 16 targets with 5 successes.
rotePool: Resolve + Medicine + Life vs Stamina + Gnosis

name: Curse of Predation
description:
• The mage creates a cursed object that attracts carnivorous animals to its owner.
  • The object emits distress pheromones of a wounded animal, triggering attack instincts of nearby predators.
  • The specific predators attracted depend on the location, including birds, coyotes, hyenas, wolves, bears, big cats, and domesticated dogs in urban areas.
  • The time interval between serious animal attacks depends on the amount of Mana spent during item creation.
  • The more Mana spent, the shorter the interval between attacks.
  • Additional inconsequential animal attacks may occur between intervals, typically from small creatures.
  • Owners may experience dogs straining at leashes but failing to attack.
  • Extra precautions are necessary in certain situations, as even small animals can pose risks.

name: Palsy
description:
• The mage afflicts the subject with powerful tremors and muscle spasms, robbing them of motor control.
  • The mage must first successfully grab hold of the target to cast the spell.
  • The spell reduces the subject's Dexterity by the number of successes achieved on the roll.
  • This reduction affects all traits dependent on Dexterity, including Defense.
  • If the subject's Dexterity reaches zero or below, they lose coordination and fall to the ground.
  • With Life ●●●●, the spell can be cast at targets in sensory range.

name: Honing the Form
description:
• The mage can raise one Physical Attribute, either their own or that of a base or median life form.
  • Each success on the spell raises the chosen Attribute by one dot, up to the maximum of the caster's Life Arcanum dots.
  • The spell also modifies derived traits related to the raised Attribute, such as Speed, Health, or Initiative.
  • If multiple spells are cast to boost different Physical Attributes, only the spell with the highest Potency takes effect.
  • When cast on base or median life forms, the mage must touch the target. With Life 4, the spell can be cast at sensory range.
  • If the target resists the spell, the mage subtracts its Stamina from the spellcasting dice pool.

name: Image of Striking Beauty
description:
• The mage can alter their body to appear exceptionally attractive.
  • This spell subtly changes the mage's features and influences the emotions of those who see them, making them find the mage more attractive.
  • The effects are subtle enough that the mage remains easily recognizable.
  • Each success on the spell provides a +1 modifier to all Presence and Manipulation rolls when using the mage's looks to entertain, persuade, distract, or deceive others.
  • These bonuses are compatible with those from the "Striking Looks" Merit.

name: Transfer Median Features
description:
• The mage can give a median life form features from another median or base life form.
  • Examples include giving a shark crocodilian limbs and the ability to breathe air, or giving a spider monkey a scorpion's stinger tail and venom.
  • One feature can be transferred per success.
  • At this level, the mage must touch the target, but with Life 4, they can cast the spell at sensory range.

name: Two Faces
description:
• The mage can change his features.
  • One feature may be altered per success.
  • Possible changes include eye color, skin color, hair color, hair length, and hair texture.
  • Other superficial characteristics can also be altered, such as finger or toe length, body hair, skin condition, height, weight, and facial features.
  • More extreme changes, like altering fingerprints, require Life 4.

name: Feral Reflex
description:
• The mage gains heightened agility and evasion.
  • During the spell's duration, the mage uses the greater of his Dexterity or Wits to calculate his Defense.
  • This allows the mage to move with adroitness and evade enemy attacks more effectively, similar to the instincts of animals.

name: Degrading the Form
description:
• The mage can lower one of his Physical Attributes or that of a base or median life form.
  • Each success on the spellcasting roll allows the mage to lower the attribute by one dot, up to a maximum amount equal to his Life dots.
  • If the spell is cast on a base or median life form, one Mana must be spent and the target's Stamina is subtracted from the spellcasting dice pool.
  • This spell can be used to make the mage or the target appear infirm or feeble.
rotePool: Stamina or Resolve or Presence + Athletics + Life - Stamina

name: Verminous Metamorphosis (Life)
description:
• The mage can transform lifeless material into simple vermin such as spiders, scorpions, or biting flies.
  • The number of successes determines the number of objects transformed and the size of the swarm created.
  • A swarm of vermin can attack anyone within its radius, causing one die of bashing damage.
  • The damage inflicted by the swarm can be increased by condensing the swarm, adding one die of damage per step smaller on the success chart.
  • The vermin can be given venom at a -2 dice penalty, and victims must make a Stamina + Survival roll to resist the effects of the venom.
  • The vermin created are mindless and act solely on instinct, making them naturally aggressive.
rotePool: Wits or Intelligence + Animal Ken + Life

name: Gaia's Hold
description:
• The mage uses flora to slow and entangle the target.
  • The spell functions best in areas with abundant plant life.
  • Each success on the casting roll reduces the target's Speed by 2.
  • If cast as an extended spell, the flora continues to creep up the target's body, attempting to hold them in place.
  • The extended spell functions as a Grapple attack, with total successes acting as the Strength of the attack.
  • If the target breaks the grapple, all successes are lost.
  • If the total successes to grapple the target exceeds twice their Size, the target is considered Immobilized.
  • Casting Gaia's Hold as an extended spell costs one Mana.

name: Banish Plague
description:
• The mage can cure sickness or disease in others.
  • At this level, the mage must touch the target.
  • With Life ●●●●, the spell can be cast at Sensory Range.
  • The spell follows the same mechanics as Life ●● Self Purging.

name: Chemical Imbalance
description:
• The mage can disrupt the chemical balance of the brain, affecting the target's motor skills and emotions.
  • At this level, the spell is somewhat imprecise and does not allow for specific emotional manipulation.
  • The effects of the spell can resemble intoxication, manic depression, hormonal imbalances, or general unruliness with vertigo.
  • The penalties on social rolls range from -1 to -5, depending on the caster's successes.
  • No penalties are applied to other rolls for 1-3 successes, but penalties of -1 to -4 are applied for 4-5 successes.

name: Skilled Triumph
description:
• The mage taps into the realm of body memory, akin to the Collective Unconscious but focused on physical abilities.
  • By accessing this realm, the mage can perform extraordinary physical feats effortlessly.
  • Each success on the spellcasting roll grants the mage a use of the rote action ability.
  • The rote action can be applied to any Physical Skill.
  • These uses are restricted to non-magical Skill rolls and cannot enhance magical abilities.

name: Animal Minion
description:
• The mage gains control over the movements of a base or median life form.
  • This control is akin to manipulating a marionette, allowing the mage to direct the creature's actions.
  • While other Life spells influence a creature within its instinctual behavior, this spell allows the mage to push it beyond those boundaries.
  • If the target is unconscious, it is easier to control without resistance.
  • Conscious targets can resist the control by making a reflexive and contested Resolve roll.

name: Accelerate Healing
description:
• The mage can use Mana to heal bashing or lethal damage in a reflexive manner.
  • The healing is limited to the amount of Mana the mage can spend in a turn, based on their Gnosis.
  • Bashing damage is healed first, followed by lethal damage.
  • This spell is subject to Disbelief and Unraveling if used in front of Sleepers to heal lethal damage.
  • The spell has no effect on aggravated damage.

name: Trigger the Lizard Brain
description:
• The mage can control the instinctual reactions of human beings.
  • At this level, the mage must touch the target.
  • With Life 5, the spell can be cast at Sensory Range.
rotePool: Manipulation or Wits + Intimidation + Life vs. Resolve + Gnosis

name: Enfeeblement
description:
• The mage can degrade one of another person's Physical Attributes.
  • Successes determine the number of dots that can be lowered, up to the mage's Life dots.
  • The mage must first grab hold of or touch the target.
  • A roll of Strength or Dexterity + Brawl - target's Defense is required to successfully grab hold of the target.
  • With Life 5, the spell can be cast at sensory range as an instant action.

name: Doppelganger
description:
• The mage can transform their build and features to resemble another person of any gender, age, and size.
  • Conservation of mass is disregarded, allowing significant changes in height and weight.
  • The spell can be used to become an Everyman or adopt specific characteristics suitable for a particular task.
  • The mage's physical capabilities (Attributes) remain unchanged unless other Life Arcanum alterations are applied.
  • The completeness of the transformation depends on the number of successes achieved in casting.
  • Each success allows the mage to change one aspect of their physical form, including height, girth, and facial features.
  • Unique features such as eye color, scars, or birthmarks require a success for each distinct feature.

name: Shapechanging
description:
• The mage can transform into any form of natural biological life more advanced than a single-celled organism.
  • The mage takes on the physical characteristics, including Attributes and Size, of the chosen organism.
  • Dice penalties are incurred for significant changes in Size, both reductions and increases.
  • The mage can augment the Physical Attributes of the transformed form with other magic.
  • In situations where the transformed form has strong instinctual responses, the mage must make a Composure + Resolve roll to assert their reason over instincts.
  • The mage's clothes and gear remain unchanged, but may be affected by the transformation depending on the Size difference.
  • By adding the Matter Arcanum, the mage's clothes and equipment can be transformed to fit the new shape and size.
  • With Matter 5, the clothes and gear can be incorporated into the new form and transform back when the spell ends.

name: Supreme Honing
description:
• The mage can raise multiple Physical Attributes, either his own or those of a base or median life form.
  • The successes can be divided between the Physical Attributes in any combination the mage prefers.
  • The maximum boost to each Attribute is still limited by the mage's total Life dots.

name: Contagion
description:
• The mage can cause sickness or disease in others.
  • The required number of successes depends on the virulence and transmission of the disease being mimicked.
  • The mage must mimic an existing disease, with more virulent or easily transmitted diseases requiring more successes.
  • The disease is contagious, and anyone exposed to it has a chance of catching it.
  • A reflexive Stamina + Athletics or Survival roll might prevent someone from contracting the disease.

name: Animal Degradation
description:
• The mage can degrade multiple Physical Attributes of a base or median life form.
  • The mage can allocate their successes among the target's Physical Attributes in any combination.
  • The total amount of degradation for each Attribute is limited by the mage's total Life dots.
rotePool: Resolve + Animal Ken + Life vs. Stamina

name: Uplift the Species
description:
• The mage can transform a base life form into a median life form.
  • The transformed creature retains only the basic instinctual programming of its new form.
  • The mage must touch the target to cast the spell, but with Life 5, they can cast it at sensory range.

name: Life Force Assault
description:
• The mage uses the Unraveling practice to attack a target's life force.
  • This practice allows the mage to inflict lethal damage to the target's life force.
  • The number of successes determines the amount of damage inflicted.
  • With Life 5, the mage can spend one Mana to inflict aggravated wounds.
  • The target's Stamina is subtracted from the spellcasting roll.

name: Transform Other
description:
• The mage can grant another human being features from a base or median life form.
  • The target must be touched for the spell to be cast.
  • With Life 5, the mage can cast the spell at sensory range.
  • This spell is similar to the Life 3 Transform Self spell, allowing the mage to give the target features from another life form.
  • The specific features granted depend on the mage's successes.
rotePool: Presence + Animal Ken + Life vs. Stamina + Gnosis

name: Control Reactions
description:
• The mage can evoke a specific emotional response in the target by combining emotional suggestions, telepathic messages, and physiological control.
  • The spell can be used to manipulate the target's emotions and reactions to specific events.
  • Subtle uses include influencing decision-making, dismissing certain beliefs, or accepting dubious explanations.
  • The spell can also be used to discredit individuals by provoking inappropriate emotions and causing them to appear emotionally unbalanced.
  • The target experiences the physiological signs of the desired emotion, which can affect how they are perceived by others.
  • The spell adds or subtracts one die from the target's Social rolls depending on the caster's intent.
  • The target genuinely feels the emotions and physiological reactions induced by the spell, which may lead them to justify their actions.

name: Many Faces
description:
• The mage can change another person's features using the Life 3 Two Faces spell.
  • The spell requires the mage to touch the target, but with Life 5, it can be cast at sensory range.
  • The target has the option to contest the spell by making a reflexive Composure + Gnosis roll.
rotePool: Manipulation + Subterfuge + Life vs. Composure + Gnosis

name: Perfect Mask
description:
• The Guardian can use this spell to draw from the memories of a person she mimics.
  • The person to be mimicked must be within sensory contact of the caster.
  • This spell combines elements of the Life 4 "Doppelganger" spell and the Mind Arcanum.
  • The spell allows the mage to blend into her surroundings by pulling enough knowledge from the target's mind.
  • The knowledge obtained is appropriate to a certain location or set of circumstances, allowing the mage to pass herself off as if she belongs there.
  • The spell does not grant the mage any special skills she does not possess.

name: Hone Another's Form
description:
• The mage can raise one of another human being's Physical Attributes.
  • The mage must touch the target to cast the spell, but with Life 5, they can cast it at sensory range.
  • The target has the option to resist the spell by subtracting their Resolve dots from the spellcasting dice pool.

name: Evolutionary Shift
description:
• The mage can transform a base or median life form into a human being.
  • The transformed creature retains its animal mind and behavior.
  • The spell's range is sensory.
rotePool: Intelligence + Animal Ken + Life vs. Stamina

name: Greater Shapechanging
description:
• The mage can change shape without the risk of losing control of her faculties.
  • The mage can also change others with the same ease.
  • The mage retains full control of her reason in the new form.
  • The mage is not restricted to lesser life forms for the shape change.
  • The mage must account for modifiers for Size changes.
  • The mage can add different features to the changed form using the Life 3 Transform Self spell.
rotePool: Stamina + Animal Ken + Life vs. Stamina + Gnosis

name: Ghastly Metamorphosis
description:
• The gruesome spell transforms a subject into a new shape, including humans or animals of Size 4-6.
  • Each success of the spell inflicts one level of lethal damage on the subject.
  • Onlookers unfamiliar with the magic may need to make Resolve + Composure rolls to resist gaining a temporary mild derangement.
  • The spell has a limited Duration and may cause the subject to become "lost" to their new form.
  • The subject retains their Awakened abilities, if any, while in the new form.
rotePool: Strength or Presence + Animal Ken + Life

name: Ultimate Honing
description:
• The mage can raise multiple Physical Attributes of another human being using the Life 4 Hone Another's Form spell.
  • The spell can be cast at sensory range.
  • Successes can be distributed among the subject's Physical Attributes as desired.
  • The maximum boost for each Attribute is determined by the mage's Life dots.
  • The target has the option to resist the spell by subtracting its Resolve dots from the spellcasting dice pool.

name: Animate Homunculus
description:
• The alchemist creates a homunculus by imbuing it with life.
  • A dot of Willpower must be permanently sacrificed to perform this spell.
  • The number of successes on the casting roll determines the traumatic transition of the homunculus.
  • The homunculus may gain derangements and/or flaws based on the number of successes.
  • The Storyteller chooses the derangements and flaws randomly or based on the model of the homunculus' persona.
  • If the model has existing derangements or flaws, the homunculus may inherit them.
  • If the model has no derangements or flaws, the Storyteller creates exaggerated derangements and flaws for the homunculus.
  • The weaver of the homunculus' persona may allocate successes to select specific derangements and flaws.
  • The number of successes determines the mix of defects the homunculus will have.
  • The table shows the possible combinations of derangements and flaws based on the number of successes.

name: Create Life
description:
• The mage has the power to create living biological creatures.
  • The creature can be up to the most complex of natural organisms.
  • Without the use of other Arcana, the created creature is mindless and driven only by instinct.
  • The creation of life grants the mage a sense of godlike authority.
  • This spell falls under the Practice of Making.
  • The casting requires an Extended action.
  • The duration of the spell is prolonged, lasting for one turn.
  • The casting is considered vulgar.
  • The cost of casting the spell is 1 Mana.
  • The required number of successes is determined by the creature's Size and Physical Attributes.

name: Ultimate Degradation
description:
• The mage has the ability to lower multiple Physical Attributes of a person.
  • The spell can be cast at sensory range.
  • Successes can be divided among the target's Physical Attributes.
  • The total reduction for each Attribute is limited by the mage's Life dots.
rotePool: Strength + Athletics + Life vs. Resolve + Gnosis

name: Regeneration
description:
• The mage has the ability to temporarily regenerate lost limbs or organs.
  • The number of successes required depends on the specific body part or organ to be restored.
  • The regeneration process occurs at a rate of one success per minute.
  • The spell can only be cast on living targets.
  • The spell's duration can be extended using advanced prolonged duration factors, but it cannot be made indefinite.

name: Fantasia
description:
• The mage has the ability to transform a base or median life form into a human being.
  • The mage can add and subtract various features from the target animal.
  • Each success allows the mage to exchange a single feature.
  • Unnatural features may incur a penalty to the casting roll.
  • Changes in Size require successes on a one-for-one basis.
  • The spell's range is sensory.
  • Sleeper Disbelief can dispel the spell, reverting the creature to its natural form.

name: Human Minion
description:
• The mage can exert gross bodily control over human beings using the Life 4 Animal Minion spell.
  • The mage can control the affected human like a marionette.
  • A human cannot be forced to do anything that endangers their survival or causes harm to themselves.
  • If the mage commands the human to do something that goes against their beliefs (such as harming a loved one), a fresh contested and reflexive Resolve + Gnosis roll is made to resist the command.
  • The target's successes on the roll must exceed the spell's Potency to successfully resist the command.
rotePool: Manipulation + Pursuasion + Life vs. Resolve + Gnosis

name: Hereditary Change
description:
• The mage can bestow characteristics of other life forms onto a creature.
  • This spell is often combined with another spell that alters the creature's features, such as Transfer Median Features or Fantasia.
  • The mage must touch the target, its egg, or the belly of the beast carrying the unborn animal.
  • The changes made through this spell are lasting and become the creature's natural form.
  • The altered traits can be passed down through heredity, creating a magical bloodline.
  • It is recommended to keep these fantastic creatures hidden away from the sight of Sleepers, as witnessing them can cause sickness and even death in the creature.
  • Sleepers' Disbelief successes can deliver bashing damage to the creature when witnessed.
  • The Disbelief dice pool can be reduced by playing to prevailing local myths or by keeping the altered creature away from populated areas.
rotePool: Intelligence or Resolve + Medicine + Life vs. Stamina

name: Craftsman's Eye
description: analyze workings of mechanical operations

name: Crafter's Eye
description:
1. The mage has the ability to see any wear, flaws, breaks, or damage in a specific object.
  2. This spell allows the mage to compare the object's current state to its ideal or original state.
  3. Success in casting the spell grants the mage knowledge of what is wrong with the object and provides a rough understanding of the necessary repairs.
  4. The mage's proficiency in skills like Crafts and Science will determine the extent of their ability to fix the object.

name: Discern Composition
description:
1. The mage possesses the ability to perceive the fundamental makeup of material structures and discern their composition.
  2. This allows the mage to determine the weight, density, and composition of objects.
  3. Technologically inclined mages often view this ability through a scientific lens, while others perceive it as interconnected threads or elements.
  4. By successfully casting the spell, the mage can determine an object's Durability, Size, and Structure ratings.
rotePool: Wits or Intelligence + Crafts or Science + Matter

name: Counterspell (Matter)
description:
• The mage creates Pattern interference to weaken or cancel a Matter spell.
  • Mage Sight is required to perceive the attacking spell and counter it.
  • Counterspell can be cast against vulgar spells from mages with higher Initiative.
  • Counterspell can also be used to counter sympathetic spells cast directly at the mage.
  • Successes subtract from the target spell's Potency; if reduced to zero, the spell is canceled.
  • Covert spells require identification before countering, while vulgar spells can be countered immediately.
  • Countering a spell aimed at multiple targets affects all targets.
  • Countering requires at least one dot in an Arcanum used by the attacking spell.

name: Find the Hidden Hoard
description:
1. The mage possesses the ability to find secret compartments within inanimate matter.
  2. This allows the mage to discover hidden doors, safes, and vaults.
  3. Some exceptionally well-designed hidden compartments may impose a penalty of -1 or -2 dice on the mage's attempt to find them.
  4. This ability is particularly effective in detecting misdirectional architecture and hidden structures.

name: Eye for Destruction
description:
1. This spell allows the caster to perceive hidden flaws in lifeless objects.
  2. The spell can be used to identify flaws in objects made of inanimate matter, including animated corpses.
  3. The caster gains the ability to ignore a single point of an object's Durability when trying to break it.
  4. If the spell is used against reanimated dead, the caster receives a single bonus die when making physical attacks.
  5. This spell does not apply to sentient undead such as vampires or Prometheans.
rotePool: Wits + Crafts (for objects) or Occult (for the animate dead) + Matter

name: Dark Matter
description:
• The mage gains Mage Sight, this spell is effective for reading ponderous or dense resonances.
  • Successes in the scrutiny reveal clues about various aspects of the investigated resonance.
  • The Storyteller should make the rolls, sharing information each time a success is rolled.
  • The analysis can yield useful information even if the scrutiny is abandoned before completion.
  • Suggested equipment, such as crystals or gems, can enhance the appearance of resonance.
  • The density of the subject affects the dice pool with corresponding modifiers.
  • When scrutinizing magic with this spell, the mage receives a +1 dice bonus for dense/very dense resonance and a -1 dice penalty for refined/very refined resonance.

name: Breach Point
description:
1. This spell allows the mage to discern hidden vulnerabilities in any form of cover used by enemies during combat.
  2. The spell's purpose is to differentiate between different types of cover, such as shooting through a car door with multiple layers versus shooting through a thin sheet of metal.
  3. Each success of Potency assigned to the spell counts as an extra success of damage, specifically for overcoming the Durability of the cover.
  4. This bonus damage makes it easier for the mage to harm the target behind the cover with ranged attacks.

name: Alter Conductivity
description:
1. This spell allows the mage to alter the conductivity of a simple object, either making it non-conductive or conductive like a different material.
  2. The number of objects that can be affected increases with each success achieved.
  3. With 1 success, the mage can affect 1 object. With 2 successes, 2 objects can be affected, and so on.
  4. The maximum Size of the objects that can be affected is 20.
  5. If the mage wants to affect larger objects, they suffer dice penalties unless additional Size factors are added.

name: Detect Substance
description: locate chosen substance in area

name: Temporary Repair
description:
• The mage can temporarily repair inoperative machines with worn, broken, or missing parts.
  • The spell does not work on machines lacking fuel or energy, or those affected by software issues.
  • Once the spell's duration ends, the machine reverts to its original state without any additional damage.
  • The spell does not cause any additional damage apart from normal wear and tear.

name: Shape Liquid
description:
• The mage can shape and move liquid or vapor through touch or sensory range.
  • The spell works on liquids and vapors, but not on gases like mustard gas or helium.
  • The mage can allocate successes to determine the volume, density, and strength of the liquid.
  • A Dexterity + Crafts roll may be required for complex shapes or details.
  • The shaped liquid retains its form but provides no barrier or protection unless allocated successes to Strength.

name: Unseen Aegis
description:
• The spell provides subtle protection from physical harm by acting on inert material in the mage's vicinity.
  • Air cushions impacts, moisture douses flames, and bullets lose some of their impact.
  • The mage gains one point of armor per dot in the Matter Arcanum.
  • By spending one Mana, the Duration can be extended to one day.
  • Successes are used to resist attempts to dispel the protective shield.

name: Eyes of the Earth
description:
• This spell is similar to the Matter ● Dark Matter spell, but it can be cast on another mage or supernatural being.
  • If cast on a Sleeper, it immediately invokes Disbelief, even if its Duration is less than one scene.
  • The target can resist the spell by making a reflexive contested Resolve + Gnosis roll.
rotePool: Wits or Presence + Occult or Science + Matter

name: Transmute Water
description:
• The mage can transmute one common liquid substance into another common liquid substance.
  • The transmutation can turn water into milk or orange juice into gasoline.
  • The mage must touch the targeted liquid or vapor to be able to affect its adjacent volume.
  • The volume of liquid or vapor that can be affected increases with the number of successes.
  • With higher levels of the Matter Arcanum, the mage can transmute multiple liquid substances and cast the spell at sensory range.

name: Weaponize Object
description:
• The mage can fortify a mundane item, turning it into an effective hand-held weapon.
  • The spell sharpens the object's edges, shifts its balance, or toughens its exterior to make it serviceable for combat.
  • The object's composition is altered, allowing the mage to use it as a weapon without suffering the usual penalty on attacks made with improvised weapons.
  • The object's Damage is calculated by the higher of its Durability or Size, rather than the lower.
  • Almost any object can be used, as long as the mage can pick it up and move it, but the mage's Strength must exceed the weapon's Size rating to avoid a penalty on attacks.

name: Control Object
description:
• The mage can communicate with the spirit of a device and ask it to perform actions within its normal range of function.
  • A successful roll convinces the device's spirit to act as desired, such as firing a gun or starting a car.
  • The mage can only affect devices that are visible and within comfortable speaking range.
  • The spell does not grant access to restricted information or allow devices to perform actions beyond their normal functions.
  • Devices cannot break or disable themselves unless it is part of their normal use, but visible parts can be manipulated.

name: Steel Windows
description:
• The mage can make an opaque object transparent or vice-versa, or selectively affect only one surface of the object.
  • To cast the spell, the mage must touch the targeted object, but tools like forceps or other tools can be used for indirect contact.
  • The spell allows the mage to make the outer surface of objects transparent, enabling them to see the internal mechanisms or contents.
  • It is important to note that the spell's effects are subject to the rules of Paradox and may draw attention to the mage's actions.

name: Alter Accuracy
description:
• The mage can enhance the balance and heft of a simple item, improving its performance and usability.
  • Objects such as swords, screwdrivers, or hammers can benefit from the spell, allowing for increased accuracy, quicker turns, or stronger impacts.
  • The spell grants the target object the 9-again quality on its next dice roll, improving the chances of success.
  • Extra successes on the spellcasting roll provide additional rolls with the enhanced tool, with one extra roll per success.
  • The affected rolls gain the 9-again benefit until the number of affected rolls is used or the scene ends, whichever comes first.

name: Deceptive Appearance
description:
While the Matter spells that actually transform substance work on different types of substances at different levels, Deceptive Appearance can target any non-living, non-magical substance, regardless of rarity or physical state. 
This spell can change the appearance of any solid, liquid or gas object to that of any other simple substance of the same state. A complex object can be made to take on the overall appearance of any simple substance, but separate spells must be used to give the appearance of separate substances.
Note: The change granted by Deceptive Appearance is visual only.

name: Manufacture Medication
description:
1. The alchemist creates medication in pill or intravenous liquid form.
  2. The medication can heal or enhance the user's Physical Traits.
  3. Pills take effect after a delay based on the user's Stamina.
  4. Additional successes during creation allow precise specification of the delay.
