  5. Intravenous drugs take effect in one turn, regardless of Stamina.

name: Animate Object
description: The Willworker can temporarily awaken the spirit within an object or device and animate it so it can move and act on its own.

name: Manufacture Spray
description:
1. The alchemist creates a low-density liquid that can be dispersed into a mist.
  2. The liquid is imprinted with a spell that harms or influences a target.
  3. The effect is triggered when the liquid is sprayed on the target.
  4. Modified canisters are used to contain and deliver the spray.
  5. To use a spray canister, one must be within melee range and make a successful attack.

name: Jury-Rig
description:
1. The spell allows a mage to combine pieces of various machines to produce a desired result.
  2. Each success allows the mage to transpose one quality or characteristic from one mechanical object to another.
  3. Firearm characteristics can be swapped or incorporated into other devices.
  4. The mage must touch the jury-rigged object to cast the spell.
  5. With Matter 4, the spell can be cast at sensory range.

name: Manufacture Oil or Jelly
description:
1. The alchemist creates a sticky, viscous substance that can be used as a salve.
  2. The salve is imprinted with a spell that alters inorganic matter.
  3. The effect of the spell is triggered when the salve is rubbed onto the target object.

name: Backbite
description:
1. The mage alters the configuration of a weapon to make it dangerous for its wielder.
  2. When someone attempts to use the weapon, they suffer their attack successes as damage.
  3. The user's Defense does not apply, but Armor might provide protection.
  4. The spell is cast by touching the targeted weapon, or with Matter 4, it can be cast at sensory range.
  5. Adding Space 2 to the spell allows the mage to affect weapons out of normal sensory range.

name: Alter Integrity
description:
1. The mage can reinforce or degrade an object's Durability.
  2. For each success on the casting roll, the player can add or subtract one point from the object's Durability.
  3. Altering Durability also affects the object's Structure accordingly.
  4. The spell is cast by touching the targeted object, or with Matter 4, it can be cast at Sensory Range.
rotePool: Intelligence or Wits + Crafts or Occult + Matter

name: Verminous Metamorphosis (Matter)
description:
1. The mage can transform lifeless material into simple vermin, such as spiders, scorpions, or biting flies.
  2. The number of objects transformed and the size of the swarm created depends on the number of successes achieved.
  3. The swarm's radius increases with more successes, ranging from 1 yard to 16 yards.
  4. The caster can direct the swarm using the Life 2 "Control Base Life" spell.
  5. The swarm inflicts one die of bashing damage to anyone within its radius. Additional damage can be inflicted by condensing the swarm.

name: Manufacture Drop
description:
• The alchemist manufactures gross material in the form of a liquid designed to be dropped into the eye or ear canal.
  • These drops can carry spells that convey information to the user or alter their perceptions.
  • When the alchemical drop is placed in the eye or ear, the imprinted spell takes effect immediately.

name: Plasticity
description:
• This spell allows the mage to render any reasonably homogeneous material malleable for a limited time, even normally inflexible substances.
  • The material can be molded by hand or with magic, creating fantastic shapes and forms.
  • At this level, the mage must touch the targeted object, but with Matter 4, the spell can be cast at sensory range.
  • The material's Durability determines the difficulty of the spell, with higher Durability materials being more resistant.
  • Once cast, the effect takes place in the subsequent turn, and the material returns to its original solid state when the Duration expires.

name: Repair Object
description:
• The mage can repair an object without leaving seams, making it appear as if it was never broken.
  • Successes achieved repair Structure points on a one-for-one basis.

name: Reassembly
description:
The mage calls and reassembles the widely separated parts of an item. 
The number of successes rolled determines the size of the object that the spell can restore. The size of the fragment and the number and distance of the pieces do not matter. As long as the mage is holding a piece of the object large enough to see and feel clearly she can call the remainder of the pieces of the object and reassemble 
If some pieces no longer exist, then the spell creates new matter to repair the missing portions in a manner similar to the “Repair Object” spell. However, at least half of the object must still exist in some form similar to its original state.

name: Perfect Lock
description: No key or application of the Larceny Skill can open the Perfectly Locked door.

name: Alter Raiment
description: change appearance of clothing but not material.

name: Armor Piercing
description:
• This spell bestows the "armor piercing" quality upon an object.
  • The object gains the armor-piercing quality on the next dice roll made using it.
  • Each extra success affects the object for one additional roll.
  • The caster's Matter proficiency determines the amount of armor or Durability points the object can ignore.
  • The mage can affect multiple bullets, with one bullet per success.
  • The number of bullets affected can be doubled by adding additional Target factors to the casting, with a penalty to the roll.
  • In the case of autofire, a burst with at least one bullet affected by the Armor-Piercing spell gains the full effect of the spell.
  • The number of bullets required for a burst to ignore armor depends on the length of the burst.

name: Transmute Earth
description:
• This spell allows the mage to transmute one common solid substance into another.
  • The transmutation is limited to a single material and cannot involve precious or rare substances.
  • The mage must touch the targeted object to cast the spell.
  • With Matter 4, the spell can be cast at sensory range.
  • Radical transmutations may incur spellcasting penalties.
  • The spell does not alter the shape or Size of the object, only its material substance.
  • The weight of the object adjusts accordingly to the new substance.
  • With Matter 4, a solid object composed of multiple materials can be affected.
  • The mage can choose to transform specific parts or sorts of materials within an object.
  • The spell also allows for the transformation of complex materials into simpler ones.

name: Manufacture Powder
description:
• The alchemist creates an explosive powder as gross material.
  • The powder can be imprinted with any spell that has an area effect.
  • The imprinted powder is typically placed in an explosive device, such as a flash grenade.
  • The powder is triggered when ignited, activating the imprinted spell.
  • The spell's effect occurs centered around the location of the detonated grenade.
  • The explosion serves as the radius for the spell's area effect.

name: Bundle Enhancements
description:
• Matter-based finishing spells can be bundled together into a single omnibus spell.
  • The bundled spells count as one spell for active maintenance and relinquishment.
  • Relinquishment cost can be the standard Willpower dot or an alternative cost.
  • Multiple willworkers can contribute finishing spells to the item.
  • The designated willworker can actively maintain and relinquish control of the combined spell.

name: Manufacture Salve
description:
• The alchemist creates a salve, cream, or unguent.
  • The salve contains a specific spell effect.
  • The imprinted spell in the salve protects the beneficiary from harm or influence.
  • The spell is triggered when the salve is rubbed on the beneficiary's body.
  • The salve can be applied by the beneficiary or another individual.

name: Transubstantiation of Content
description: With a successful casting of this spell, a mage can alter the medium of any data without altering the underlying meaning of the content. More dramatic uses of the spell can condense a stack of tomes into a single flash drive or vice versa, though the total size of all objects before and after transformation cannot exceed 5, and the mage cannot create any data medium that he is not personally familiar with.

name: Annihilate Matter
description:
• The mage can dissolve inert matter and make it cease to exist.
  • Hardness or density of the material does not affect the spell.
  • Each success inflicts one point of damage on the object.
  • Magical items, supernatural compounds, and alloys cannot be destroyed with this spell.
  • A separate Matter 5 spell is required to annihilate extraordinary matter.

name: Duplication
description:
When casting this spell, the mage must have a supply of raw material out of which the duplicate may be created. If these raw materials are of approximately the right sort and of at least the same Size, then a single success creates a nearly exact duplicate, and further successes create increasingly perfect duplicates. To create a lasting duplicate, the raw material must be quite similar in both composition and form to the object being duplicated. 
This spell can also be used to duplicate Artifacts, enhanced and imbued items if cast as a conjunctional spell with Prime 3; however, duplicates of Artifacts or imbued items made with this spell all have a maximum Duration of 24 hours and can never be made lasting, regardless of the raw materials or power level involved.
This spell is the only known method for duplicating Artifacts, but none of these duplicated Artifacts can ever exist for more than 24 hours.

name: Stone Servitor
description:
• This spell creates a self-aware servant made of animate stone.
  • The servant's base Strength, Durability, and Size are determined by the lesser of the mage's Matter or Gnosis.
  • Potency successes can be assigned to enhance the servant's attributes.
  • The servant has no Stamina rating but possesses one dot in Dexterity and all Mental and Social Attributes.
  • The servant cannot possess Skills or Merits.
  • The servant's weight increases with each dot of Size.
  • The servant's consciousness dissipates at the end of the spell's Duration.
  • Re-casting the spell before its Duration ends can extend its duration.
  • The construct can be modified using the Matter Arcanum.

name: Alter Efficiency
description:
• Improve or degrade mechanical object's workings
  • Equipment modifiers can be increased or decreased by one die per success
  • Maximum speed or acceleration of a vehicle can be adjusted
  • Maximum speed: +/- 10 mph per success (max: +/- 50 mph)
  • Acceleration: +/- 5 per success (max: +/- 25)
  • Spellcasting range: touch (Matter 4), sensory range (Matter 5)

name: Shape Air
description:
• Control the flow and density of air or gas
  • Successes determine defined volume and pressure
  • Shaping air may require a Dexterity + Crafts roll
  • Dots of Strength act as Durability against attacks
  • Control and move affected area up to one yard per dot of Gnosis per turn
  • Forces 3 allows for greater motion: 10 yards per dot of Gnosis per turn
  • Wind strength can knock people over if it exceeds their Strength

name: Reconfigure Object
description:
• Transform an object into a different type of object
  • Material substance remains unchanged (ie. baseball bat into wooden sword)
  • Durability, Structure, and Size of the object are not changed
  • Can be combined with Transmute Earth for material composition change

name: Transmute Gold
description:
• Transmute precious or rare substances into common substances
  • Similar to Transmute Earth
  • Can be cast on precious substances or rare materials
  • Cannot alter the substance's state without combining with Lesser Transmogrification

name: Lesser Transmogrification
description:
• Transmute liquid substances into solid substances and vice versa
  • Similar to Transmute Water and Transmute Earth spells
  • Mage can mix and match liquid and solid states
  • Cannot turn objects into impossible substances

name: Fold Object
description:
• Changes a three-dimensional object into a two-dimensional one
  • Object retains weight but its volume is reduced
  • Allows the object to be folded like paper
  • Mass is shifted into an extra-dimensional space
  • Each success can affect five cubic feet of solid matter
  • Object can be restored to full volume reflexively
  • Object returns to full volume instantly when the spell expires
  • Nearby individuals may be subject to Knockdown

name: Transmute Air
description:
• Transforms one gaseous substance into another gaseous substance
  • Examples include turning nerve gas into harmless oxygen or oxygen into laughing gas
  • Does not alter the dispersion of the gas, only its substance

name: Forge Thaumium
description:
• Masters of Matter can forge a substance called "thaumium" that serves as a shield against mystic will
  • The shape and size of a thaumium object do not affect its countermagic abilities
  • The spell creates a Size 1, Durability 1 piece of thaumium that can hold one point of Mana
  • Additional successes are needed to increase the Mana capacity, Durability, Size, armor, and equipment modifier
  • Thaumium disintegrates when the Duration expires, but can be cast with an indefinite Duration
  • Once made, thaumium must be charged with Mana points for it to shield against magic
  • Thaumium provides reflexive counterspelling against any Arcana and both vulgar and covert magic
  • Thaumium weapons can use stored Mana to inflict aggravated damage
  • Thaumium must be Size 3 or larger to act as effective armor

name: Self-Repairing Machine
description:
• The mage can give objects a self-repairing function
  • The materials of the object bond with nearby molecules and atomically restructure themselves
  • Each success allows the object to recover one Structure point of damage
  • The self-repairing process occurs at a rate of one point per 15 minutes

name: Alter Size
description:
• The mage can give objects a self-repairing function
  • The materials of the object bond with nearby molecules and atomically restructure themselves
  • Each success allows the object to recover one Structure point of damage
  • The self-repairing process occurs at a rate of one point per 15 minutes

name: Raw Creation
description:
• The mage can create an object out of nothing
  • The size of the created object is determined by the number of successes rolled, with a maximum Size of 3
  • Additional successes can be allocated to reinforce the Durability of the object
  • Complex objects may require additional rolls, such as Intelligence + Crafts or Science, to create accurately
  • Certain objects may require specific Skill Specialties to create

name: Construct Homunculus Form
description:
• The alchemist creates a lifeless, inanimate physical form known as a homunculus, or "proto," using this spell.
  • The creation of the homunculus requires multiple instances of the spell, and the successes can be accumulated over time.
  • The alchemist chooses the size of the homunculus, with larger sizes requiring more successes.
  • The homunculus can be made to resonate as human by incorporating human flesh or bone, but this subjects it to aging and decay.
  • The alchemist infuses the proto with Physical Attributes and Skills, with a limit of five dots per trait.
  • The outer surfaces of the homunculus can be armored, with increasing levels of armor resulting in a more bizarre appearance.
  • The alchemist can equip the homunculus with natural weapons, such as claws or horns, with the success cost based on the damage dealt.
  • Failures on the casting roll deform the proto, adding visible imperfections or unusual physical features.
  • Dramatic failures require starting the spell over, and subsequent attempts may result in additional deformities or grotesque features.
  • It is worth noting that some mages intentionally introduce imperfections into the creation process to avoid acts of hubris.

name: Greater Transmogrification
description:
• The mage can transform liquids and solids into gases, and vice-versa, in any combination.
  • This spell allows for the interchange of liquid, solid, and gaseous states.
  • The transformation can be applied to precious or rare substances as described in the Transmute Gold spell.
  • The details of the Matter 4 Lesser Transmogrification spell apply to this spell as well.

name: Annihilate Extraordinary Matter
description:
• The mage can destroy enchanted substances that are normally protected, including enhanced or imbued items, Artifacts, and thaumium.
  • This spell functions similarly to Annihilate Matter, inflicting one point of damage per success on the object.
  • No need to overcome the object's Durability is required to damage it.

name: Sense Consciousness
description:
• The mage can detect the presence of minds in the material world or in the state of Twilight.
  • This sense allows the mage to know when other thinking creatures are present and roughly what types of minds are present.
  • The mage can detect the general type of mind (e.g., ghost, disembodied consciousness, spirit).
  • Successes are used to pierce any supernatural occlusion a mind may possess.
  • The spell creates a "safety zone" around the mage, preventing minds from entering without their knowledge.

name: Counterspell (Mind)
description:
• The mage creates Pattern interference to weaken or cancel a Mind spell.
  • Mage Sight is required to perceive the attacking spell and counter it.
  • Counterspell can be cast against vulgar spells from mages with higher Initiative.
  • Counterspell can also be used to counter sympathetic spells cast directly at the mage.
  • Successes subtract from the target spell's Potency; if reduced to zero, the spell is canceled.
  • Covert spells require identification before countering, while vulgar spells can be countered immediately.
  • Countering a spell aimed at multiple targets affects all targets.
  • Countering requires at least one dot in an Arcanum used by the attacking spell.

name: Aura Perception
description:
• The mage can discern the mental and emotional states of a thinking being by reading their aura.
  • Auras can be perceived as colors, musical notes, odors, tastes, or other non-physical senses.
  • This spell does not reveal a target's nature, which requires the Supernal Vision spell.

name: Mask of Normality
description:
• The spell causes Sleepers to perceive an item of unusual shape or aspect as an everyday, contemporary object.
  • It can be cast on a newly manufactured item or used to retrofit an antique object for discreet use.
  • The spell can also update an object's appearance while maintaining its basic apparent form.
  • Examples include disguising a sword as an umbrella, a scepter as a walking stick, etc.
  • Onlookers must make contested Wits + Investigation rolls against the spell's Potency to see through the illusion.

name: One Mind, Two Thoughts
description:
• The spell allows the mage to hold two individual and distinct trains of thought simultaneously.
  • The two thoughts must not involve intense physical demands, but one can require minimal physical exertion.
  • The mage can perform two separate extended-action knowledge tasks simultaneously.
  • Examples include researching an occult fact while composing a poem.
  • The spell does not allow for multitasking involving physical labor.

name: Third Eye
description:
• The mage gains Mage Sight, allowing them to perceive exceptional mental powers and read resonances.
  • Successes in the scrutiny reveal clues about various aspects of the investigated resonance.
  • The Storyteller should make the rolls, sharing information each time a success is rolled.
  • The analysis can yield useful information even if the scrutiny is abandoned before completion.
  • Suggested equipment, such as crystals or gems, can enhance the appearance of resonance.
  • The density of the subject affects the dice pool with corresponding modifiers.
  • The mage can sense when others nearby use exceptional mental powers, such as telepathy or ESP.

name: Emotional Urging
description:
• The mage can project emotions onto others as suggestions rather than mandates.
  • The suggested emotions are likely to be heeded if they make sense for the individual and situation.
  • Targets with at least Mind ● may have an inkling of being manipulated through their Unseen Senses.
  • A reflexive Wits + Composure roll can be made to sense the manipulation of emotions.
  • Further knowledge can be gained by casting additional magic, such as Third Eye.
  • Mages often react by erecting a Mental Shield.
rotePool: Manipulation + Empathy + Mind vs. Composure + Gnosis

name: Alter Aura
description:
• The mage can alter her own aura to create the appearance of any mental or emotional state.
  • She cannot change her nature to appear as something she is not, such as a Sleeper or vampire.
  • When cast conjunctionally with Prime 2, the spell can also change the nature of the mage's aura.
  • The spell cannot be detected except by Third Eye or Supernal Vision Mage Sight spells with higher Potency.
  • Even if detected, the true mental or emotional state of the mage can only be perceived by overcoming the spell's Potency with a spell designed to read an aura's mental state, unless the altered aura is dispelled.

name: False Speech (lesser)
description:
• The mage can cause spoken words within the radius of effect to be heard as desired.
  • There are two versions of the spell: lesser variant (stationary on an area) and greater variant (moves with target).
  • To make different people seem to say different things, the mage needs to be able to multitask with Mind Arcanum spells.
  • Subjects who roll fewer successes than the caster hear whatever the mage wants them to hear.
  • Subjects who successfully contest the magic hear garbled words while in the affected area.

name: Mental Shield
description:
• The mage can erect a mental shield to protect himself and his thoughts.
  • The shield subtracts one die per dot in the Mind Arcanum from spells or supernatural powers that attempt to control, detect, or influence the mage.
  • By spending one Mana, the Duration can be extended to one day.
  • Successes are used to resist attempts to dispel the shield.
  • The Mental Shield allows the caster to see through mental illusions like Misperception or Imposter.
  • A contested Gnosis + Mind roll is made to see through the illusion upon first encountering it.
  • The spell can be cast at any point in a turn, similar to a dodge action.

name: Beast Control
description:
• The mage can manipulate the mind of a simple creature (reptile, insect, fish, or invertebrate) through basic telepathic control.
  • The mage can command the creature to perform specific tasks as long as the creature understands the behavior.
  • Compulsions cannot be completely harmful to the creature.
  • Each success allows for one distinct task to be commanded.
  • The effect lasts until the tasks are complete or for one scene, whichever comes first.
rotePool: Presence + Animal Ken + Mind vs. Resolve

name: Opening the Lidless Eye
description:
• This spell is similar to the Mind ● Third Eye spell, but can be cast on another mage or supernatural being.
  • If cast on a Sleeper, it immediately invokes Disbelief, even if the spell's Duration is less than one scene.
  • If the target is unwilling, they can resist with a reflexive and contested Resolve + Gnosis roll.

name: Moment of Doubt
description:
• The mage implants a brief sensation of doubt in the target's mind, causing them to feel uncertain and second-guess themselves.
  • Each success subtracts one die from the target's dice pools on instant or extended actions for the duration of the spell.
  • The doubt is lifted if the target succeeds at any roll.
  • The spell cannot be cast on the same target more than once per scene.
  • If the target is a mage with Mind 1 or greater, they can make a reflexive Wits + Composure roll to sense the presence of mental manipulation.

name: Misperception
description:
• The mage manipulates perceptions to appear slightly displaced from their actual location, causing attackers to misjudge their position.
  • The mage gains one point of armor per dot in the Mind Arcanum.
  • By spending one Mana, the Duration can be extended to one day.
  • Successes are used to resist attempts to dispel the shield.
  • The armor provided by this spell applies against attempts to grapple the caster, but not against overpowering or inflicting damage once a hold has been achieved.
  • An attacker protected by Mental Shield may see through the illusions of Misperception with a contested Gnosis + Mind roll.

name: Inconspicuous Object
description:
• The mage can make an object unnoticed, even if it is in plain view.
  • The spell applies the effects of the Incognito Presence spell to an object equal to or smaller in Size than the lowest of the mage's Matter, Mind, or Gnosis scores.
  • If any attention-grabbing activity is performed with the object or by someone openly possessing it, the spell's effects are terminated.

name: Voice from Afar
description:
• The mage can engage in limited telepathic projection to communicate mentally with others.
  • The communication does not carry any supernatural compulsion.
  • The recipient is aware that the thoughts are not his own, unless mentally disturbed or inclined to believe in hearing voices.
  • Each success allows the projection of one word.
  • If the target is aware and willing, their Resolve does not subtract from the caster's dice pool.

name: Phantom Thoughts
description:
• With a single success on the casting roll, the mage can add a layer of conscious thought over her own mind
  • This layer contains information chosen by the mage during the casting
  • Repeated attempts to read a mind protected by this layer may reveal the shallowness of thinking
  • Suspicious mages may roll Resolve + Composure minus the Potency of the Still Waters casting to confirm if the mind they are attempting to read has been altered

name: Hurried Rest
description: reduce amount of sleep needed by half

name: Eagle-Eye View
description: For each success accumulated on the casting roll, the mage gains a +1 to his Initiative.

name: Control Waking
description: make target sleep deeper or wake up instantly

name: Perfect Mnemonic
description:
• In order to cast this rote, the mage must vocalize the intended knowledge to the subject, even if that subject is the mage himself
  • If the spell succeeds, the subject never forgets that information without the interference of other magic or powers
  • Resolve is not subtracted from the caster’s pool if the target is aware and willing

name: Memory Hole
description:
• The mage can compartmentalize his mind to hide certain thoughts or memories from himself and others.
  • This allows him to tell convincing lies, even under scrutiny such as a polygraph test.
  • Each success subtracts one die from others' dice pools for rolls to detect specific lies he might tell.
  • The mage can hide specific memories or thoughts, but cannot conceal every truth he knows at once.

name: Incognito Presence
description:
• The mage can blend into a crowd and go unnoticed by others.
  • Witnesses sense nothing special about the mage and are likely to dismiss her presence.
  • People on the street take no more notice of her than they would a Sleeper.
  • Blatantly attention-grabbing actions violate the subtle occlusion of the spell.
  • The spell affects anyone who witnesses the mage, without the need for special targeting.
  • Those with supernatural mental protection can resist the spell with a contested roll.
  • If successful, the onlooker can remember the mage normally.

name: First Impressions
description:
• The mage can generate a sense of familiarity, trust, or connection with another person.
  • This sensation can make the chosen person feel more at ease in the mage's presence.
  • It can help establish the groundwork for a friendship, love affair, or a successful con.
  • Each success adds one die to the mage's dice pool for the first Social Attribute-based roll with the individual.
  • The result of the first impression tends to stick with the subject and influence future interactions.

name: Delayed Rest
description:
• The mage can remain clear-headed and organized for a period of time, regardless of how long they have been awake.
  • Each success rolled in the casting allows the mage to ignore one die of penalties caused by fatigue, but only for mental or social actions, not physical actions.
  • The mage must still roll to stay awake every six hours, following the rules for "Fatigue" in the World of Darkness Sourcebook.
  • This spell can only be used a number of times per week equal to the mage's rating in the Mind Arcanum.
  • If the mage adds two dots of Life to the casting, they can ignore one die per success of fatigue-based dice penalties for physical actions.

name: Inspire
description:
• The mage can telepathically implant a single idea into the mind of the target.
  • The idea must be relatively simple and can be summed up in a single sentence.
  • The target will believe the idea came as a flash of inspiration.
  • The target is not compelled to act on the idea in any particular way.
  • The target may follow, try, or dismiss the idea based on their own judgment.
  • Targets with Mind 1 or greater can attempt to sense the intrusion with a reflexive Wits + Composure roll.
rotePool: Manipulation + Expression + Mind vs. Resolve + Gnosis

name: Gain Skill
description:
• The mage temporarily gains knowledge and use of a particular Mental or Social Skill.
  • The chosen Skill is determined when the spell is cast.
  • Each success on the casting roll grants the mage one temporary dot in the chosen Skill.
  • The maximum number of temporary dots is equal to the mage's Mind Arcanum dots.
  • All temporary dots must be allocated to the same Skill.
  • The Skill cannot increase above five dots using this spell.
  • Once the spell ends, the temporary Skill dots and their associated capabilities disappear.
  • This spell has limited use for performing extended actions as it lasts for one scene.

name: Greater Beast Control
description:
• The mage can manipulate a median mind, excluding primates, cetaceans, and cephalopods.
  • The mage can exert control over most animal life within this range.
  • The controlled creatures can be compelled to perform actions according to the mage's desires.
  • The compelled actions cannot be completely inimical to the creatures.
  • This spell functions similarly to Beast Control, but with a focus on median minds.
  • The effect lasts until the tasks are completed or for one scene, whichever comes first.
rotePool: Presence + Animal Ken + Mind vs. Resolve

name: Curse of Ostracism
description:
• The curse is woven into a physical object and drains the Social Attributes of its owner.
  • To trigger the curse, the victim must willingly possess the item.
  • Once triggered, the victim loses one dot in a Social Attribute at predetermined intervals.
  • Dots are lost from the victim's highest Social Attribute first.
  • If two or more Attributes have the same value, the Storyteller randomly chooses between them.
  • The attribute damage is permanent until the item is destroyed, disenchanted, or acquired by a new owner.
  • Knowing victims are motivated to pass the cursed item along to avoid the ongoing effects.

name: Telepathic Alarm
description:
• This defensive magic establishes a telepathic connection between the owner of an object and any unauthorized person who comes into contact with it.
  • The owner can sense the interloper's identity and read their conscious thoughts.
  • The owner can also project her own thoughts into the interloper's mind, triggering Disbelief in Sleepers.
  • If the owner knows Space 2, the owner can cast spells at the interloper from a distance.
  • To weave this magic into an item, the caster needs at least +5 successes on the target number.
  • With +10 successes, the owner can choose to make the telepathic link one-way, allowing them to eavesdrop without the interloper's awareness.

name: Induce Hoarding Instinct
description: item crafting, curse

name: Bestow High Speech
description:
• Mortals, Sleepwalkers included, cannot comprehend High Speech in any form.
  • A target of this spell can perceive the true form of High Speech for the duration; he can also understand and speak the language as if he possessed the High Speech Merit.
  • This spell can be cast on one of the Awakened without using Prime.

name: Telepathic Eavesdropping
description:
• The mage can tap into a telepathic connection between two or more individuals, listening to their thoughts and feeling their emotions.
  • This spell requires the mage to have the Mind 1 "Third Eye" spell active in order to target the telepathic waves of thought.
  • It can tap into mental links created by spells like Mind 3 "Telepathy" or Mind 5 "Network," allowing the mage to perceive conscious thoughts sent through those links.
  • Completely unidirectional links, such as those used for reading memories or telepathic control, cannot be tapped by this spell.
  • Mages with "Third Eye" spells can make a Wits + Composure roll to notice the tap, with a penalty of one die for each success the caster rolled to activate the spell.
  • With Mind 4, the mage can extend the Duration of the spell.
  • With Mind 5, the mage can use advanced-prolonged Duration factors.

name: Precious Malediction
description:
• Precious Malediction is cast on a cursed object and detects when the owner intends to destroy it.
  • If the owner attempts to destroy the object or induce others to do so, they must contest Resolve + Composure against the spell's Potency.
  • On a failed roll, the owner becomes fiercely protective of the item and suffers severe anxiety for a duration of one hour per point of Potency.
  • During this time, the owner suffers a -1 die distraction penalty on all rolls with a Resolve or Composure component.
  • Affected owners must do everything in their power to prevent the item from being harmed.
  • Before using "Supernal Vision" to determine if the item is cursed, a mage must contest Resolve + Composure against the spell's Potency.
  • On a failed roll, the mage is convinced that the item is not cursed, regardless of any supernal perceptions to the contrary.
  • If the mage failing the roll is not the object's owner, they are possessed by an intense desire to become the owner.
  • This powerful obsession lasts for one hour per point of Potency and the non-owner suffers a -1 distraction penalty on all rolls with a Resolve or Composure component.
  • The period ends prematurely if the examining mage becomes the object's owner.

name: Bestow Skill
description:
• The mage can temporarily grant knowledge and use of a particular Skill to another individual.
  • This spell is similar to the "Gain Skill" spell, but the mage can cast it on others to grant them additional dots in a specific Skill.
  • The mage can grant one dot in the chosen Skill per success rolled, up to a maximum of the mage's rating in the relevant Arcanum.
  • Once the spell ends, the Skill dots and any capabilities that came with them disappear.
  • The effects of this spell last for one scene.

name: Telepathy
description:
• The mage can establish direct mind-to-mind contact with another sentient being, allowing for telepathic communication and the sharing of thoughts, images, and emotions.
  • The target cannot be compelled to act in a specific way, but the telepathic link can be used for social persuasion or to facilitate the use of other spells that involve psychic commands.
  • The spell allows the mage to perceive only the target's conscious thoughts. To access subconscious thoughts, the mage needs to have Mind ●●●●.
  • The Duration of the spell is transitory, but additional successes can extend the duration.
  • Telepathically gifted individuals may sense the mind-to-mind contact initiated in their vicinity and can attempt to intrude or spy on the communication.
  • Multiple minds can be contacted by adding Target factors, but the mage does not serve as a "psychic switchboard." With Mind ●●●●●, a network of multiple minds can be established.
  • Contacting a Sleeper with this spell causes Disbelief.
rotePool: Wits + Empathy + Mind vs. Resolve + Gnosis

name: Passion Link
description:
• The mage forges a connection between a topic and a powerful emotion in the subject's mind.
  • The subject's emotions are overridden when the trigger topic is mentioned, causing a strong emotional response.
  • The spell does not grant the mage control over the subject's response to the emotion.
  • The spell links one topic to one emotion, such as anger, joy, shame, sadness, or fear.
  • The mage can study the target to better understand their likely reaction to the emotion by making an extended Intelligence + Empathy roll.
rotePool: Composure + Subterfuge + Mind vs. Composure + Gnosis

name: False Speech (greater)
description:
• The mage causes spoken words within the radius of effect to be heard as desired.
  • The spell can be cast on an area or an individual/object that moves with the target.
  • The mage needs to be able to multitask to make different people seem to say different things.
  • Subjects who fail to contest the magic hear whatever the mage wants them to hear.
  • Subjects who succeed in contesting the magic hear garbled words within the affected area.

name: Eternal Now
description:
• For the Duration of the spell, the target can remember any memories of experiences that occurred before the spell was cast
  • The target, however, cannot form any new memories

name: Multi-Tasking
description:
• The mage can perform three mental extended actions or two mental instant actions simultaneously.
  • Spellcasting is not included as one of the actions that can be performed simultaneously.
  • This spell allows for complex multitasking within the realm of mental activities.
  • It works in conjunction with the Mind ● One Mind Two Thoughts spell.

name: Goetic Struggle
description:
• The spell summons an inner demon into the mage's consciousness and binds it to his will.
  • When the mage's Vice might come into play, he can mentally wrestle the demon through a contested roll.
  • If the mage wins the contest, he gains Willpower as if his action had reflected the Vice.
  • If the demon wins the contest, the mage must act out the Vice without gaining Willpower.
  • The demon is banished after the contest, and the spell must be cast again to gain the same effect.

name: Kinesthesia
description:
• For the Duration of this spell, the mage’s Defense is not reduced by multiple attackers
  • She disregards one point of any environmental penalties to her actions per point of Potency assigned to the spell
  • Furthermore, the mage need not check to overcome or avoid simple hindrances on the field, such as:
    • Dodging around the protruding root of a tree
    • Vaulting up a slight incline to obtain a better position
  • She is assumed to have the necessary grace, awareness, and multitasking abilities to automatically do so

name: Psychic Assault
description:
• The mage performs a psychic assault on the target, causing damage to their body.
  • Successes inflicted on the target cause bashing damage on a one-for-one basis.
  • The spell can affect vampires as well, despite their different brain functioning.

name: Universal Language
description:
• The mage can translate any idea into or out of any language based on root concepts.
  • The spell works for spoken words, written words, encoded signals, and thought-based concepts.
  • The mage must be able to perceive the medium in which the idea exists.
  • There may be limitations in expressing the translated concept, depending on the physical capabilities of the mage.
  • The obscurity of the language or the alien nature of the concepts may impose dice penalties ranging from -1 to -3.

name: Defer Conscience
description:
• After successfully casting this spell, the Arrow defers any roll for degeneration until the end of the current scene
  • At the end of the current scene, she rolls for the single most heinous sin — as determined by the tenets of Wisdom — that she committed while under the effects of the spell
  • This roll is based on the sin she would normally have to roll, given her current Wisdom score
  • If the mage degenerates in Wisdom, she still rolls as normal to resist gaining a derangement
  • Note that, while this spell’s Duration may be increased, this simply extends the length of time during which the mage benefits from its effects
  • She still checks for degeneration at the end of every scene during which she took actions that call for such

name: Mental Wall
description:
• The mage can erect a mental shield on another person, similar to the spell Mental Shield.
  • This spell provides protection to the target's thoughts, shielding them from mental control, detection, or influence.
  • The mage subtracts one die per dot in the Mind Arcanum from spells or supernatural powers that attempt to mentally control, detect, or influence the target.
  • The duration can be extended by spending one Mana, lasting for one day.
  • Successes can be used to combat attempts to dispel the shield.

name: Denial of Senses
description: For each success reduce target's Reflexive Perception rolls by one

name: Curse of Dementia
description:
• The mage casts the "Curse of Dementia" spell, similar to the "Curse of Withering" spell from the Death Arcanum.
  • The spell is cast on an item, and when its owner takes possession of the item, it begins to drain the owner's Mental Attributes.
  • At predetermined intervals, the owner loses one dot in a Mental Attribute.
  • The duration of the curse depends on the interval chosen and the target number required for casting.
  • The attribute damage is permanent until the item is destroyed, disenchanted, or acquired willingly by a new owner.

name: Imposter
description:
• The mage creates a false image, making others perceive them as someone else.
  • Each success in the casting makes the false image seem true to one sense.
  • Occasional rolls may be needed for the mage to convincingly act like the impersonated person.
  • If suspicions arise or the mage fails a relevant roll, a target can make an Intelligence + Investigation roll to detect the deception.
  • The spell cannot replicate the Striking Looks Merit's benefits or the impersonated person's charisma.
  • Targets with supernatural mental protection can contest the spell with a Gnosis + Mind roll.
  • If the target's roll successes equal or exceed the caster's casting successes, they will know the caster is an imposter.
rotePool: Intelligence + Subterfuge + Mind vs. Composure + Gnosis

name: Implant Subliminal Message
description:
• The mage implants a subliminal message in electronic media to influence the viewer's perception.
  • The message is simple and typically affects skepticism or specific emotional reactions.
  • The spell's effectiveness depends on the connection between the spell and the targeted story.
  • A closer connection between the spell and the story results in a smaller dice penalty.
  • The spell's power relies on Sleepers' belief in the mass media, but there is still difficulty in overcoming skepticism towards magic.
rotePool: Wits + Subterfuge + Mind vs. Composure + Gnosis

name: Sleep of the Just
description:
• The mage can regulate her sleep duration and control when and about what she dreams.
  • Each success allows her to stay awake for 24 hours without needing a roll to remain awake.
  • Successes also extend the maximum number of days she can stay awake before passing out.
  • During sleep, she can control the content of her dreams and perform mental tasks as if awake.
  • She retains any accumulated successes upon waking for extended tasks.
  • Supernatural attempts to intrude or manipulate her dreams must contend with the spell's potency.

name: Know Thyself
description:
• Mages can change their own memories and alter basic personality traits.
  • The Guardians of the Veil often use this spell to sift through their own memories.
  • Successes must exceed the Potency of any memory-altering spell to detect the alterations.
  • Realizing memory alterations doesn't cancel the spell; it requires specific Prime magic.
  • Mages with Mind 4 can use this spell on others to detect memory manipulations.

name: Eyes of the Master
description:
• Caster can perceive anything the target senses with their five mundane senses
  • Requires concentration for the caster to actively "ride" the target

name: Augment the Mind
description:
• The mage can raise one of his Mental or Social Attributes
  • A single Mental or Social Attribute may be raised by one dot per success
  • The maximum limit for raising the attribute is the caster’s Mind Arcanum dots
  • Raising Resolve and/or Composure also raises Willpower dots, but these extra dots do not provide Willpower points
  • The target’s Willpower capacity can be increased, but the actual supply of Willpower points remains the same
  • The target’s Willpower cannot exceed 10 dots, regardless of how high Resolve and/or Composure is boosted with this spell
  • Note that the same spell cast to boost a different Mental or Social Attribute does not combine with the first spell

name: Aura Cloak
description:
• The mage alters another person’s aura as he does for himself with Alter Aura
  • The alteration affects the aura appearance but not the person’s actual emotional state
  • The target has the option to contest the spell
  • The target can contest the spell with a reflexive Composure + Gnosis roll

name: Directed Havoc
description:
• The spell allows unauthorized users to activate an item's imbued spells.
  • When activated, the spell redirects the effect to a different target.
  • The target is determined based on what would displease the unauthorized user the most.
  • The number of successes during item enchantment determines the dice pool for the defense mechanism.
  • The defense mechanism is contested by the unauthorized user's Resolve + Gnosis.

name: Enforce Paradigm
description:
• The spell causes Sleepers to interpret supernatural phenomena as mundane and scientifically explicable.
  • Sleepers perceive bizarre occurrences as ordinary events within a materialist worldview.
  • Sleepers under the spell cannot trigger Disbelief and do not apply a bonus to Paradox rolls.
  • A dramatic failure on the casting increases the likelihood and severity of Paradoxes.
  • Each additional supernatural event allows Sleepers a chance to break the spell and perceive events accurately.
  • Mind 4 allows for a prolonged duration of one scene.

name: False Fame
description:
• The mage creates the illusion of fame, making people believe they know the mage but can't remember their name.
  • The mage receives preferential treatment, perks, and indulgence due to the illusion of being famous.
  • Overuse of the spell can be risky, as it may attract unwanted attention or exposure.
  • The target's likelihood of being star-struck or impressed affects their contesting dice pool.
  • Dots in the Fame Merit increase the potency or target factors of the spell.
  • Dots in the Occultation Merit subtract from the mage's dice pool.

name: Induce Sleep
description:
• This spell has no effect on anyone who is wide awake, frightened, or otherwise not fatigued or sleepy
  • The mage uses this spell on a sleeping target
  • Unless the target suffers damage or significant pain, she will not awaken for the Duration of this spell
  • As long as targets are not injured, they will not awaken
  • If this spell is used upon a target who is awake but also exhausted, sleepy, drunk, or otherwise in a state in which it is easy to fall asleep, the target gradually falls asleep over the course of around 15 minutes
  • Additional successes reduce the time required for the target to fall asleep

name: Shroud of Disinterest
description:
• The spell creates a psychic energy field around an object, making it difficult to notice or remember.
  • Observers must roll Wits + Investigation to take note of the object's presence.
  • A contest occurs when observers' attention strays from the item, with the user contesting Wits + Investigation against the spell's Potency.

name: Breach the Vault of Memory
description:
• The spell allows the mage to manipulate, modify, or delete a subject's memories.
  • The depth and significance of the memory determine the difficulty of manipulation, with penalties ranging from none to -5.
  • The memories return after the spell expires, but attempts to restore them may be penalized based on the caster's successes.
  • The target's supernatural identity and abilities cannot be tampered with.
  • Mages with Mind ● may have a sense of being mentally attacked and can detect attempts to alter their memories with a Wits + Composure roll.
rotePool: Manipulation + Subterfuge + Mind vs. Resolve + Gnosis

name: Skeptic
description:
• This spell affects the mind of a target Sleeper within sensory range
  • Any roll for Paradox in the presence of the targeted Sleeper gains the 9-again quality (re-roll results of 9 and 10)
  • In addition, any covert spell the Storyteller rules improbable is considered vulgar
  • The Storyteller may call for a degeneration roll for overuse of this spell

name: Read the Depths
description:
• The mage can enter a subject's subconscious and access their memories, including remote or traumatic ones.
  • Accessing certain memories may incur penalties, such as -3 for particularly remote or traumatic memories.
  • The mage can also discover the subject's Virtue and Vice through this telepathic connection.
  • If the target is a mage with at least Mind ●, they may have a sense of being "read" and can attempt to detect intrusion with a Wits + Composure roll.
  • With Mind ●●●●●, the spell can have a prolonged Duration when cast on mages or other supernatural targets.
rotePool: Manipulation + Empathy + Mind vs. Composure + Gnosis

name: Memory Oath
description: On a trigger specific memories are deleted from a subject's mind.
rotePool: Manipulation + Subterfuge + Mind vs. Resolve + Gnosis

name: Hallucination
description:
• The mage creates a sensory hallucination, affecting one of the target's senses.
  • Extra successes allow the hallucination to affect additional senses.
  • The hallucination can be any sensory experience the mage can imagine within the realm of the five senses.
  • Tactile hallucinations can hinder or incapacitate the target, but they are illusory and do not have physical effects.
  • The illusion can have a specific programmed action or be directed by the mage's concentration per turn.
  • An implausible action by the hallucination may allow the target a chance to realize that their senses are being deceived.
rotePool: Intelligence + Subterfuge + Mind vs. Resolve + Gnosis

name: Psychic Sword
description:
• The mage performs a greater Psychic Assault.
  • Successes inflict lethal damage on a one-for-one basis.
  • With Mind ●●●●●, one Mana can be spent to make the damage aggravated.
  • This psychic assault is extremely painful and exceeds any known scale for headache pain.

name: Knowing the Dead
description:
• This spell functions much like the Mind 4 spell "Reading the Depths," but it is specifically designed to work on ghosts
  • Learning any of the secrets of dying or any events the ghost experienced since its death is exceptionally difficult
  • This spell allows the mage to read the ghost's mind and learn about the events of the ghost's life
  • If the ghost is willing to permit the mage to examine its memories or if the mage has already used magic to control this ghost, the ghost does not receive a Resistance roll

name: Severed Sense
description:
• A mage can effectively "turn off" a target's senses.
  • Each success rolled shuts down one of the target's senses: sight, sound, taste, smell, or touch.
  • This can be used to protect the target from certain dangers or to prevent them from witnessing certain events.

name: Skill Mastery
description:
• The mage temporarily gains knowledge and use of one or more Skills.
  • This spell works similarly to the Gain Skill spell.
  • Skills can exceed six dots, up to a maximum rating of the caster's Gnosis.
  • Successes from this spell can be split among multiple Skills, rather than applied to only one.

name: Supreme Augmentation
description:
• The mage can raise more than one of his Mental and Social Attributes.
  • This spell is an advanced version of the Mind ●●● Augment the Mind spell.
  • Successes can be allocated among the mage's Mental and Social Attributes in any combination.
  • The total increase for each Attribute is limited by the mage's total Mind dots.

name: Dream Traveler
description:
• The mage can psychically enter the dreams of another person.
  • This spell is similar to Psychic Projection, but specifically targets a sleeping individual.
  • The mage can use Mind spells to manipulate the dreamscape and control the content of the subject's dreams.
  • By adding extra Target factors, the mage can link her dreams with others, allowing them to share a common dream.
rotePool: Manipulation + Occult + Mind vs. Composure + Gnosis

name: Shape Soul Stone
description:
• The mage can change the shape of her soul stone using this spell.
  • The mage must touch the soul stone to cast the spell.
  • Simple shapes are easier to achieve, while complex objects require additional crafting and understanding.
  • If the desired form contradicts the mage's Path, a penalty is applied to the casting roll.
  • The mage can change her soul stone's form without crafting an Imago if she doesn't require it to function as a specific tool.
  • With Mind ●●●●●, the mage can also use this spell on another mage's soul stone, but resistance may be encountered.

name: Psychic Projection
description:
• The mage can project his mind into the state of Twilight using this spell.
  • The mental form can be affected only by mind-affecting powers.
  • The mentally projecting mage cannot affect physical things except through magic.
  • While projected, the mage's body is comatose, and he has no awareness of its condition without using other magic.
  • If the mage's body dies while projected, he may become a ghost and move to an appropriate anchor.
  • The mage's soul serves as a conduit between his body and his distant consciousness while projected.

name: Augment Other Minds
description:
• The mage can raise one of another person's Mental or Social Attributes using this spell.
  • It functions similarly to the Mind ●●● Augment the Mind spell.
  • With Mind ●●●●●, the mage can allocate successes between different Mental and Social Attributes.
  • This allows the mage to enhance specific attributes of the target person.

name: Triumphant Will
description:
• For each success on the spellcasting roll, the mage gains one use of the rote action ability
  • The rote action ability can be used on any skill in either the Mental Skill or Social Skill lists
  • The category of skills must be chosen when the spell is cast
  • This ability may only be used on non-magical skill rolls

name: Autopilot
description:
• The mage can create an artificial mind in a vehicle using this spell, allowing it to control the vehicle and operate as an autopilot.
  • The autopilot has basic Traits such as Intelligence, Wits, Resolve, and Drive.
  • It is not truly sentient and lacks Social Attributes.
  • The autopilot can understand and obey the caster's commands, as well as anyone designated by the caster at the time of casting.
  • Commands can be based on destination or given as basic instructions.
  • The autopilot cannot communicate with anyone.

name: Befuddle
description:
• The mage can lower another person's Mental or Social Attributes using this spell.
  • The mage must successfully grab hold of or touch the target before casting the spell.
  • Each success on the casting roll subtracts one dot from one of the target's Mental or Social Attributes, to a minimum of 1.
  • The maximum amount by which an Attribute can be lowered is equal to the mage's dots in the Mind Arcanum.
  • Lowering Resolve or Composure also affects the target's Willpower and Initiative, while lowering Wits might affect their Defense.
  • If multiple spells are cast to lower different Attributes, only the spell with the highest Potency takes effect.

name: Telepathic Control
description:
• The mage can exert telepathic control over higher minds, including humans.
  • Subjects cannot be compelled to undertake actions against their nature or blatantly suicidal actions.
  • Additional targets can be added by increasing Target factors, but all affected minds must be controlled in the same way.
  • If the caster commands the target to put themselves in a dangerous situation, a contested roll is made for the victim to ignore the command.
  • With Mind ●●●●●, the spell can have a prolonged Duration against mages or other supernatural targets.
rotePool: Manipulation + Persuasion + Mind vs. Resolve + Gnosis

name: Virtual Voyage
description: The Mage psychically projects into a virtualized realm of computer and communication networks like "Psychic Projection".

name: The Book of Self
description:
• This spell allows a mage to create a book or scroll that contains a copy of his consciousness, granting a form of immortality.
  • The book is created using the Mind 5 "Psychic Genesis" spell and the Matter 5 "Raw Creation" spell.
  • The copy of the mage's mind in the book remains in stasis until the book is opened and read.
  • The book can communicate with readers, hearing their sub-vocalized thoughts and replying in print or with pictures from its memories.
  • The book's attributes, skills, Virtue, and Vice are allocated based on the caster's own attributes and skills.
  • This spell can be cast again before the first spell expires to extend the book's life.

name: Possession
description:
• This spell allows the mage to psychically possess another individual, leaving his own body comatose as in Psychic Projection.
  • While possessing another, the mage uses the host's Physical Attributes and any relevant Merits or Flaws tied to their identity.
  • The mage retains all of his own qualities and can choose to suppress or allow the host's consciousness as a spectator.
  • If the possessor attempts to harm the host, a contested roll is made for the victim to break the possession.
rotePool: Manipulation + Persuasion + Mind vs. Resolve + Gnosis

name: Shadow Projection
description:
• This spell allows the mage to send her consciousness into the Shadow Realm by creating a psychic projection.
  • The psychic form is connected to the body by a silver cord, which is armored and has health based on the mage's Gnosis and Willpower.
  • The cord can only be harmed by aggravated damage.
  • If the cord is severed, the mage must find another way back to her body.

name: Psychic Domination
description:
• This spell allows the mage to completely dominate the mind of another sentient being.
  • The mage can override the target's survival instincts and deeply ingrained moral convictions.
  • The mage can issue commands that are suicidal or go against the target's core values.
  • There are no limits to the thoughts and behaviors the mage can force upon the subject.
rotePool: Presence + Intimidation + Mind vs. Resolve + Gnosis

name: Twilight Temple
description:
• This spell allows the mage to create an immaterial abode in the Twilight realm.
  • The abode can only be accessed and used by the mage's psychic form.
  • Within the temple, the mage's psychic form is protected and cannot be attacked unless the abode is breached.
  • The temple has a Durability equal to the mage's Mind Arcanum and a Structure equal to his Gnosis.
  • The temple can be created in the Fallen World or the Shadow Realm using the Shadow Projection spell.
  • The Duration of the spell depends on the number of casting successes.

name: Psychic Reprogramming
description:
• This spell allows the mage to perform psychic reprogramming on a subject.
  • The mage can change the subject's Virtue and/or Vice, as well as other aspects of their fundamental psychic makeup.
  • Each success can affect a single aspect, such as changing a friendship to a rivalry or altering the target's career path.
  • The effects of this spell are lasting against Sleepers but can be dispelled to restore the target to their previous state.
  • Dispelling the reprogramming requires successes that exceed those achieved in the initial spell.
rotePool: Manipulation + Persuasion + Mind vs. Composure + Gnosis

name: Network
description:
• This spell allows the mage to connect multiple minds, creating a network.
  • The number of targets that can be networked simultaneously depends on the number of successes achieved.
  • With each success, the mage can connect an increasing number of targets to the network.
  • Targets have the option to contest the spell by rolling Resolve + Gnosis reflexively.

name: Psychic Genesis
description:
• This spell allows the mage to create a consciousness, either bodiless or tethered to a specific vessel.
  • A simple success creates a Twilight consciousness with basic mental and social attributes.
  • Additional successes can be allocated to increase the mind's attributes and skills.
  • The consciousness can have the creator's basic personality and memories, but its ability to reason and recall memories depends on its assigned Intelligence.
  • By combining other appropriate Arcana, the mind can be tethered to a specific vessel, such as a body created with Life magic.
  • The consciousness will dissolve when the spell expires unless it is recast before the previous casting expires.
  • Creating a consciousness that is aware of its own eventual dissolution may require a Wisdom degeneration roll for the creator.

name: Discern Phantasm
description:
• The mage can see through Prime-based illusions and knows them for what they are
  • However, since these illusions have substance, they do not vanish from her sight
  • The phantasm's Potency imposes dice penalties on the roll

name: Supernal Vision
description:
• The mage gains Mage Sight, the most potent form of resonance-detecting sense.
  • Other Arcana or Prime may be required to analyze certain aspects of resonance.
  • Mage Sight can be described as sight, smell, taste, or a sixth sense.
  • +1 dice bonus on perception and scrutiny rolls to sense Awakened magic, Mana, tass, enchanted items, and Hallows.
  • If the source of mystic power is concealed, the mage's successes must exceed the Potency of the concealing magic.
  • The mage can concentrate to read a person's aura and determine their nature.

name: Counterspell (Prime)
description:
• The mage creates Pattern interference to weaken or cancel a Prime spell.
  • Mage Sight is required to perceive the attacking spell and counter it.
  • Counterspell can be cast against vulgar spells from mages with higher Initiative.
  • Counterspell can also be used to counter sympathetic spells cast directly at the mage.
  • Successes subtract from the target spell's Potency; if reduced to zero, the spell is canceled.
  • Covert spells require identification before countering, while vulgar spells can be countered immediately.
  • Countering a spell aimed at multiple targets affects all targets.
  • Countering requires at least one dot in an Arcanum used by the attacking spell.

name: Copy Grimoire
description: copy Grimoire, even if not understood

name: Analyze Enchanted Item
description:
• The mage can scrutinize an enchanted item — an Artifact, Enhanced Item, or Imbued Item — to discern its powers
  • With an exceptional success, the mage can determine if the enchanted item is cursed or has other exceptional circumstances connected to its ownership or use
  • The effect lasts for one scene
  • During this time, extended Intelligence + Occult rolls can be made to examine the enchanted item
  • Each roll takes ten minutes to complete
  • The target number for the rolls is equal to twice the enchanted item's Merit dots

name: Inscribe Grimoire
description:
• The mage can record the secrets of his rotes into a magical book readable by other Awakened minds
  • Inscribing a grimoire requires the mage to remove part of his magic, causing him to forget how to cast a rote
  • The mage can later re-learn the rote by studying his own grimoire or learning from another mage who knows the rote
  • The target number for the spell equals one success per Arcanum dot used in the rote being recorded
  • The grimoire's Duration is lasting; it cannot be dispelled and does not expire unless the grimoire itself is destroyed
  • Grimoires are sought after by orders as teaching materials and can be exchanged for favors
  • Grimoires also serve as backups in case rotes are lost due to mind manipulation or other means

name: Chronicle Resonance
description:
• Discern local sources of Resonance over time
  • Track dispersal and changes in Resonance
  • No knowledge of who or how changes were made
  • Requires concentration for duration
  • Potency determines the extent of temporal view and contests occlusions

name: Dispel Magic
description:
• Mages can dismantle or dispel existing spells
  • Requires at least one dot in each Arcanum used in the spell
  • Successes must exceed the Potency of the spell to dispel it
  • Different from Counterspell, which requires one dot in one of the Arcana used by the target spell
rotePool: Intelligence or Composure + Occult + Prime vs Potency

name: Shadow Chess
description: manifest Spirits for Duel Arcane

name: Supernal Script
description:
• The mage extracts minute traces of tass from his Awakened Pattern
  • He shapes the energy into an enchanted pigment invisible to normal senses
  • To the appropriate Mage Sight, the ink glows brightly and distinctly
  • Upon casting this spell, the mage exudes invisible ink from any or all of his fingertips
  • The magic lasts as long as he continues writing
  • If he stops writing for longer than a minute, the magic runs dry and he must cast the spell again to continue
  • While the magic lasts, he can mark surfaces using his finger as a stylus or dip a quill or other writing implement into the plasm
  • The choice of writing method depends on his preference

name: Spell Cloaks
description:
• Mage with Prime 2 can add a cloaking effect to spells
  • Cloaked spells are invisible to a mage's Unseen Senses
  • Makes it harder for those with Mage Sight to notice the spell
  • Mage Sight users can make Wits + Occult rolls to notice the spell
  • Targets suffer a dice penalty to the roll based on the cloaked spell's Potency
  • Targets can see through the spell cloak by exceeding twice its Potency with scrutiny successes

name: Activate Enchanted Item
description:
• Allows the willworker to activate a contingent Artifact or imbued item
  • Requires prior analysis of the item with Analyze Enchanted Item
  • Activation can be done at will during the spell's Duration
  • Refer to specific Merits (Artifact, Enhanced Item, Imbued Item) for more details on each type of item

name: Transform Aura
description:
• Allows the mage to alter the nature of their aura
  • Can appear as a Sleeper or inhuman creature, or hide/disperse the aura
  • Can be detected only by a higher-Potency Supernal Vision Mage Sight spell
  • Conjunction with Mind 2 allows alteration of the aura's mental and emotional state
  • Refer to Aura Signifiers for a list of aura natures

name: Squaring the Circle
description:
• Creates a mystical space for the Duel Arcane
  • Allows two mages to engage in a wizard's war
  • Refer to Duel Arcane rules for details on using this spell

name: Magic Shield
description:
• Creates a shield against outside magic
  • Provides one point of armor per dot in the Prime Arcanum
  • Duration can be extended to one day by spending one Mana
  • Shield works against spells that directly target the mage
  • Requires one Mana to contend with each incoming spell
  • Allows selective use of the shield to block hostile spells
  • Can be invested with multiple charges to store energy

name: Ephemeral Image
description:
• The Mage can create purely two-dimensional inanimate phantasms
  • The phantasms lack substance but can be overlaid over an existing surface

name: Counterspell Prime
description:
• The mage can counter spells from any Arcanum.
  • Counterspell can be used on any spell without needing one dot in the spell's Arcana.
  • Covert spells can be countered without prior identification of their components.

name: Unseen Spy
description:
• Allows the mage to go undetected while observing or interfering with spells
  • Requires a contested roll: Intelligence + Subterfuge for the spy vs. Wits + Occult for the subject
  • If the Unseen Spy exceeds the caster's successes, the spying goes undetected

name: Primal Flow
description:
• Similar to the Prime 1 Supernal Vision spell
  • Can be cast on another mage or supernatural being
  • Invokes Disbelief immediately on a Sleeper target
  • Unwilling targets can resist with a contested Resolve + Gnosis roll

name: Channel Mana
description:
• Allows the mage to channel Mana from a Hallow, tass, or an enchanted item
  • Each success allows the mage to channel one Mana point
  • Maximum amount of Mana channeled is equal to the mage's Prime dots
  • Hallows can be channeled without the need for oblation
  • Tass can be used as a source of Mana, subtracting Mana and Structure from it
  • Enchanted items with Mana stores can also be channeled
rotePool: Wits or Manipulation or Resolve + Occult or Medicine + Prime

name: Last Testament
description:
• Enchants an item to designate a rightful heir in case of owner's death or disappearance
  • Only the designated heir can attune to the item
  • Owner can designate a number of heirs equal to the spell's Potency
  • Heirs are named in order, with the next in line becoming eligible if the previous heir fails to take possession
  • If all specified heirs are dead, the item becomes generally available
  • Owners can alter the list of heirs and specify an interval of neglect
  • If the owner neglects the item for the entire interval, the first-named heir becomes the owner
  • Mages inheriting the item can designate their own new heirs

name: Magic Wall
description:
• The mage can cast a Magic Shield on another person.
  • The effects of the Magic Shield are the same as described in the Magic Shield spell.
  • If the target does not have their own Mana, the caster must incorporate Mana during casting to provide charges.
  • The subject can choose when to activate a charge of the shield.

name: Phantasm
description:
• The mage creates an inanimate phantasm, an illusion woven of Mana threads.
  • The phantasm appears as a normal object of its type to Sleeping eyes, but is actually a solidified illusion.
  • The created objects can be books, knives, chairs, stones, or any other lifeless, inanimate objects.
  • The phantasm has a Size of 5 or less and one point of Durability, making it fragile and easily breakable.
  • A reflexive Intelligence + appropriate Skill roll is required to create a convincing illusion, with excess successes adding dice to the roll.

name: Subvert Ownership
description:
• The mage can change the rightful owner, authorized users, or designated heir of an Enchanted Item.
  • This spell targets any spells woven into the item that rely on ownership designations.
  • It allows the mage to modify the spells that determine who can use or inherit the item.

name: Reset Platonic Exemplar
description:
• The mage can remove all spells woven into a Platonic exemplar.
  • This spell clears the item of all existing magics.
  • On a dramatic success, the mage can selectively choose which spells to keep and remove.
  • The mage must touch the item while casting the spell.
  • Platonic exemplars are not subject to the normal rules preventing permanent dispellation of Enchanted Items.

name: Create Tass
description:
• The mage creates tass, solidified Mana that can take the form of any object.
  • Successes are allocated between the tass' Size and Durability.
  • At least one Mana must be channeled into the tass.
  • The tass does not behave like objects made from the proper materials.
  • An extended Dexterity + Crafts roll can be made to create tass that behaves more like its representative object.
  • Tass objects inflict only bashing damage unless crafted with sharp edges.
  • Tass dissolves into the Tapestry at the end of the spell's Duration.

name: Target Interloper
description:
• The mage adds a defensive mechanism to an item.
  • Another spell must be cast into the item to target unauthorized individuals touching it.
  • The target spell must be capable of targeting an individual without complex options.
  • Add three successes to the target number for each dot of the target spell.
  • The defensive spell gains one Potency per success.
  • If the subject spell requires Mana, the item must be infused with it.
  • The item must have sufficient Mana to activate the defensive effect.

name: False Signature
description:
• The mage combines Prime 2 into her spell to alter the mystical appearance of the spell
  • This alteration changes the signature of the spell, making it appear to originate from a different Arcanum
  • For example, a Forces rote cast with the arcane signature of Time can make an opponent second guess the mage's abilities and can act as a foil to counter-magic
  • Mages using Mage Sight are allowed a reflexive Wits + Occult roll to notice the true nature of a spell's Arcanum
  • Targets suffer a -1 penalty to this roll per point of Potency of the altered spell

name: Path in the Skin
description:
• Mages use this spell to imbue their bodies with the properties of a magical tool.
  • The caster needs Life ●● to use the spell on themselves and Life ●●● to use it on another person.
  • Mages with Prime ●●●● can cast it as a permanent spell, but the recipient can cancel it.
  • An unwilling recipient contests the spell with a Resolve + Gnosis roll.
  • The recipient must be within a yard or at touch range for the spell to work.

name: Imbue Mana
description:
• The mage can imbue a living creature with Mana.
  • The caster gives one of his Mana points per success to the target.
  • The mage must touch the target during casting (or use Prime ●●●● for sensory range).
  • If combined with Channel Mana or Siphon Mana, the mage can transfer Mana between sources.
  • Channeling Mana into a living being usually has no effect, except for Awakened individuals who add it to their total.
  • If the invested Mana exceeds a Sleeper's Size, they suffer bashing damage equal to the excess points.
  • The target can resist the spell by subtracting their Stamina from the caster's roll.

name: Fortify Phantasmal Item
description:
• The mage can augment a piece of non-weapon phantasmal equipment through this spell.
  • Successes in the casting add to the equipment bonus provided by non-weapon objects made of tass.
  • The spell is covert in Aspect but suffers Disbelief if the granted bonus exceeds the base equipment bonus of the item.

name: Ley Lines
description:
• This spell harnesses the power of ley lines to generate perpetual free energy.
  • The mage creates a source of energy, known as a ley-energy node, at a convergence point of ley lines.
  • The power generated depends on the number of successes, ranging from powering a small room to a large home or office building.
  • The spell's effects are lasting unless the ley lines are disrupted.
  • The mage can only create a node at actual convergence points, which may be limited and already claimed.
  • The spell can be dispelled, causing the powered devices to cease functioning until the spell is recast or an alternative power source is arranged.

name: Controlled Dispellation
description:
• The mage can unravel an existing spell selectively, allowing it to affect only chosen targets.
  • This spell is similar to Dispel Magic but with the ability to protect specific individuals while letting the spell affect others.
  • The requirements and Arcana used are the same as Dispel Magic, unless the caster has Prime ●●●●, enabling Supernal Dispellation.
  • Controlled Dispellation makes the mage and chosen targets invisible to the unraveled spell while allowing it to take effect on others.

name: Dissolve Tass
description:
• Controlled Dispellation enables the mage to protect themselves or chosen individuals from spells while letting the spell affect others.
  • The mage's Pattern and other chosen targets become invisible to the unraveled spell, while it continues to affect unaffected targets.

name: Celestial Fire
description:
• The mage manifests celestial fire, flinging a ball of glowing, fiery energy at a target.
  • The size of the projectile allows targets to use their Defense against it.
  • One point of bashing damage is inflicted per success.
  • Celestial fire is different from mundane fire and does not have the same effects on vampires or induce Rötschreck.
  • This spell can affect beings or objects in the Twilight state, but the mage needs a magical sense like Supernal Vision to target them, or they will be firing blindly.
  • With Prime ●●●●, the damage becomes lethal, and the mage can choose to directly attack a target's Pattern (the target resists with a Stamina roll).
  • With Prime ●●●●●, spending one Mana can make the damage aggravated.

name: Disguise Spell
description:
• The mage casts Disguise Spell to change the appearance of a spell's resonance.
  • This spell only affects the spell's appearance to occult investigators using Mage Sight, not its actual effects.
  • A basic success disguises the identity, Gnosis rating, and mastery of the caster.
  • Each success allows the mage to disguise an additional quality of the spell's resonance, such as Arcanum composition, Potency, Targets, or Duration.
  • The disguised spell cannot be detected except by a Mage Sight spell with a higher Potency.
  • Even if Disguise Spell is detected, the true resonance of the spell cannot be perceived until it expires.

name: Mystic Shackle
description:
• The mage curses an item to penalize the use of one or more Arcana.
  • For every five successes added to the target number of the spell, the mage can specify one Arcanum to be affected.
  • Any mage casting a spell from any of the specified Arcana while wearing or carrying the cursed item suffers a dice penalty equal to the Mana spent during its creation.

name: Mana Leech
description:
• The mage curses an item to drain its Awakened owner of Mana.
  • Whenever the mage wearing or carrying the item casts a spell with a Mana cost, the cost increases by one.
  • The creation of this item requires 20 successes.

name: Disguise Resonance
description:
• The mage can change the appearance of an area's resonance, altering its qualities or hiding its magical signature.
  • The spell can fool spirits and masks the power level of a Hallow.
  • Each success in the casting of the spell masks one level of a Hallow's power.
  • The disguised resonance cannot be detected except by a Mage Sight spell with a higher Potency.
