  • The true resonance of the area cannot be perceived until the Disguise Resonance spell expires or is dispelled.

name: Energetic Tass
description:
• The mage can craft tass in the form of energy, such as light, fire, electricity, or sound.
  • The number of successes determines the complexity and intensity of the phenomenon created.
  • Mana must be channeled into the tass and can be withdrawn by a mage with Prime Arcanum.
  • The energetic tass can only inflict bashing damage and only if in the form of electricity or fire.
  • Specific effects and characteristics depend on the type of energy chosen.

name: Ephemeral Enchantment
description:
• The mage enchants an object, enabling it to strike or protect against entities from the Twilight or Shadow Realm.
  • If it's a weapon, it gains the ability to strike such entities. If it's armor, it provides protection against their attacks.
  • In the case of a gun, all bullets within its magazine, cylinder, or chamber are enchanted.
  • Additional magazines or ammunition can be enchanted by adding extra Target factors to the casting.
  • With Prime ●●●●●, the object can be empowered to inflict aggravated damage, requiring one Mana to be spent for each aggravated strike.

name: Imbue Item
description:
• The mage can imbue an item with magical powers, granting it one or more spells.
  • The target number for imbuing the item is equal to the combined successes required for all the spells to be imbued.
  • The mage must be able to cast each spell individually, and the target number for each spell is determined as if it were cast as an extended action.
  • Each spell remains imbued in the item for its Duration, which can be indefinite.
  • One Mana point must be spent per spell imbued, in addition to any Mana required for each individual spell.
  • The caster can choose whether the spells in the item are persistent (always active) or contingent (triggered by a word, gesture, or condition).
  • The item can be given the capacity to hold Mana points, with a capacity of 10 points plus one per spell imbued.
  • The aspect of casting (covert or vulgar) depends on the spells imbued in the item.
  • If the item is imbued with vulgar spells, it risks Paradox whenever those powers are used, with the Paradox dice pool based on the Gnosis of the item's creator at the time of creation.

name: Item Failsafe
description:
• The magician enchants an Imbued Item to make its spells inaccessible to unauthorized users.
  • For each imbued spell that is to be protected, one success is added to the target number of the enchantment.

name: Transform Other Aura
description: The mage can alter another’s aura, changing the appearance of his true nature just as he does for himself with Prime ●● "Transform Aura".

name: Armor of the Soul
description:
• The mage weaves a barrier around a soul to protect it from being stolen or severed.
  • The target gains one point of armor per dot the caster has in the Prime Arcanum against magic or powers that affect the soul.
  • By spending one Mana, the Duration can be extended to last for a day.
  • This spell can be combined with a Magic Shield spell, and the armor points from both spells are added together against magic that affects the soul.

name: Instill Exclusiveness
description:
• The mage enchants an item to prevent anyone except the current owner from accessing its imbued powers.
  • Unauthorized users are unable to draw on the item's magical properties.
  • The mage can exempt specific magical properties from the effects of this spell at the time of casting.
  • An item's enhancements are often exempted to avoid compromising its durability when handled by enemies.
  • Spells that have not yet been cast on the item at the time of casting Instill Exclusiveness are automatically exempted from its effects.

name: Payment in Power
description:
• This spell alters the cost of relinquishing a finishing spell, replacing the usual Willpower sacrifice with a Mana cost.
  • The Mana cost is paid over a period of days, with one Mana being spent at the time of casting.
  • Starting from 24 hours after casting, the mage loses one additional Mana each day for 20 days, resulting in a total expenditure of 20 Mana.
  • Mana losses occur automatically and cannot be prevented or halted by the mage.
  • If the mage runs out of Mana before the 20-day period is over, all spells woven into the item are dispelled.
  • Even if the mage has no Mana remaining, Mana will continue to drain from them at a rate of one point per day until a total of 20 points have been harvested.
  • In extreme cases, the mage may be forcibly drained of Mana to fulfill the requirements of this spell.

name: Suppress Enchantment
description:
• The mage temporarily suppresses the power of an Artifact or imbued item
  • This spell dispels any magical effects produced by the item
  • It also makes the item unusable for the Duration
  • Each use of this spell affects only one of the powers possessed by a single Artifact or imbued item

name: Scour Other's Pattern
description:
• The mage can convert a person's flesh and blood into Mana using Scour Other's Pattern.
  • The spell causes Resistant Damage, inflicting one point of lethal damage per success.
  • The caster gains one point of Mana for each success achieved.
  • If cast on a mage, the target can attempt to absorb the liberated Mana into their own pool with a Stamina + Gnosis roll.
  • This spell can only be cast once on the same target per scene and may require a degeneration roll for mages with Wisdom 4 or higher.

name: Phantasmal Weapon
description:
• The mage creates a durable phantasm, capable of functioning as weapons and armor.
  • The phantasm's Durability is equal to the caster's Prime dots.
  • Successes can be allocated to enhance the object's equipment dice modifier or armor points.
  • Successes can also be used to increase the Size of the phantasm above five points.
  • This spell is similar to Prime ●●● Phantasm, but with increased durability and potential enhancements.

name: Marionette
description:
• The mage creates an animate phantasm of an animal or non-human creature.
  • The phantasm can move as directed by the mage through active concentration.
  • Each success grants two dots of Physical Attributes to the phantasm, up to the mage's Prime dots in any one trait.
  • Combining this spell with Phantasmal Weapon allows for enhanced solidity and allocation of successes to equipment modifiers or armor.
  • The phantasm's Defense is determined by its Dexterity or the mage's Wits, whichever is lower.
  • If the phantasm's Health or Structure is depleted, it disintegrates back into the Tapestry.
  • The mage must concentrate to control the phantasm, and it cannot be directed beyond the range of the mage's mundane senses, unless scrying with the Space Arcanum.
  • In magic dead areas, the spell may require the expenditure of one point of Mana.

name: Siphon Essence
description:
• The mage can extract Essence from a spirit, ghost, or locus.
  • The extracted Essence can be converted to personal Mana.
  • Each success siphons one Essence from the target.
  • Pillaging a locus may incur the wrath of spirits and their allies.

name: Suppress Hallow
description:
• The mage can suppress an active Hallow.
  • Each success diminishes one dot of the Hallow's rating.

name: Supernal Augumentation
description:
• After casting this spell on either her own body or her weapon, the caster may reflexively spend a point of Mana when making an attack
  • This allows the single attack to inflict aggravated damage if successful, rather than bashing or lethal
  • The willworker must spend the point of Mana before making the attack
  • If the strike misses, the point of Mana is wasted
  • This spell does not otherwise alter the attack made
  • Equipment bonuses remain the same, as do a weapon's other qualities, if any

name: Supernal Dispellation
description:
• The mage can dispel magic by attacking the Pattern of a spell
  • He can destroy the spell by pulling apart the threads that comprise it
  • At this level, the mage does not need to have any dots in the Arcana used in the magic to be dispelled
  • His Prime lore is enough to unweave any spell
  • This effect works like Dispel Magic, but the mage does not need to possess all the Arcana involved

name: Awaken Hallow
description:
• The mage awakens a dormant Hallow
  • The target number is equal to the original level of the Hallow before it became dormant

name: Eyes of the Awakened
description:
• The mage grants a Sleeper the ability to have Mage Sight.
  • The Sleeper can see things that were previously considered impossible.
  • Witnessing the Mysteries does not invoke Disbelief for the Sleeper during the spell's Duration.
  • The Sleeper still influences Paradox as a normal Sleeper witness.

name: Bodyguard's Blessing
description:
• On the turn after this spell is cast, the next spell cast by the target is redirected to strike the caster of this spell
  • The mage may redirect any one spell with a Potency no higher than the number of successes gained on the casting roll

name: Disenchant Item
description:
• The mage can permanently remove one spell from an Enchanted Item using Disenchant Item.
  • This spell can target imbued spells, curses, enhancements, defenses, and the item's ability to hold Mana.
  • All Mana in the item disperses uselessly when this spell is used.
  • The mage must have at least one dot in each Arcanum used in the targeted spell.

name: Siphon Integrity
description:
• The mage can extract Mana from a mundane lifeless object using this spell.
  • Each success grants the mage one Mana and inflicts one point of Structure damage to the object.
  • The damage circumvents the object's Durability, making it brittle.
  • Only one point of Mana can be obtained per three points of Size in the object.
  • The caster can replenish their Mana reserves with this spell only once every 24 hours.
  • Enchanted items cannot be siphoned with this spell.

name: Dead Zone
description:
• The mage can create a "magic dead zone" by expelling ambient Mana from an area.
  • The strength of the Gauntlet in the area imposes a -1 penalty on the spellcasting roll.
  • Successes determine the radius or volume of the Dead Zone.
  • The mage can choose either a radius or a defined volume during casting.
  • The size of the radius or volume increases with each success.
  • The mage can spend their own Mana within a dead zone, but cannot use Channel Mana to draw from another source.
  • Places devoid of Mana can cause sickness or even death in small animals, children, and the elderly.

name: Create Hallow
description:
• The mage can create a temporary Hallow.
  • The target number is equal to the dots of the Hallow.
  • The Hallow immediately yields up its rating in Mana.
  • The effect lasts for one hour by default.
  • If the duration is extended, the Hallow only yields Mana at the same hour each day.
  • The spell has different Duration factors, but cannot last indefinitely.
  • Certain locations, such as high places, are more conducive to creating Hallows.
  • Casting the spell in less ideal locations incurs dice penalties.
  • Penalties include -1 die at sea level, -2 dice slightly below sea level, and -3 dice in a deep hole or pit.

name: Siphon Mana
description:
• The mage can siphon Mana from an unwilling mage at sensory range.
  • One Mana point is channeled per success.
  • The amount of Mana added to the caster's pool cannot exceed the maximum allowed based on their Gnosis.
  • Each successive casting against the same target within the same scene suffers a cumulative -2 dice penalty.
  • Sleepers or other creatures without spendable Mana cannot be siphoned.
rotePool: Resolve or Composure + Intimidation + Prime - Stamina

name: Forge Tulpa
description:
• The mage can create a tulpa, a materialized form of an intensely visualized idea.
  • Successes are allocated to construct the tulpa's Mental, Physical, and Social Attributes, with a maximum equal to the mage's Prime dots in any single Attribute.
  • Extra damage and armor can also be allocated to the tulpa.
  • The tulpa possesses a Willpower score and self-awareness.
  • The tulpa's Size is 5 or less, with the option to make it smaller than average human Size.
  • The tulpa can be free-willed or bound to the will of the caster.
  • A physically monstrous or bizarre tulpa invokes Disbelief when witnessed by Sleepers.
  • The tulpa dissolves when the spell's Duration expires, but can be recast to extend its existence.
  • A Wisdom degeneration roll may be required for the caster if the tulpa is not designed to accept its own demise.

name: Supernal Sense
description:
• The mage expands their sense of the Supernal to detect active spells within a certain radius.
  • By default, the mage can sense all active Supernal magic within a one-mile radius of their location.
  • Each additional success on the roll extends the range by one mile.
  • The mage can sense currently active spells as well as spells activated during the spell's Duration.
  • A specific active spell can be located with an instant Wits + Occult roll.
  • Covert magic is more difficult to pinpoint, applying a -3 dice penalty to the Wits + Occult roll.
  • The mage can only sense spell effects behind wards if the Potency of their spell exceeds that of the ward.
  • Imbued Items, Artifacts, and Legacy Attainments do not reveal themselves unless currently in use.

name: Create Complex Phantasm
description:
• The mage creates a complex phantasm that can mimic living people and complex objects.
  • These phantasms are subject to the same rules as simple moving phantasms.
  • A phantasmal person can appear to possess the same Mental and Social Attributes as the caster.
  • The phantasm can speak if compelled to by the mage.
  • The phantasm has no individual initiative and collapses if the mage doesn't actively pay attention to it.
  • Mechanical or electronic phantasms do not function normally and do not conduct electricity.
rotePool: Intelligence + Crafts + Prime (objects) or Intelligence + Medicine + Prime (people)

name: Counterspell (Space)
description:
• The mage creates Pattern interference to weaken or cancel a Space spell.
  • Mage Sight is required to perceive the attacking spell and counter it.
  • Counterspell can be cast against vulgar spells from mages with higher Initiative.
  • Counterspell can also be used to counter sympathetic spells cast directly at the mage.
  • Successes subtract from the target spell's Potency; if reduced to zero, the spell is canceled.
  • Covert spells require identification before countering, while vulgar spells can be countered immediately.
  • Countering a spell aimed at multiple targets affects all targets.

name: Finder
description:
• The mage can flawlessly track a specific object in their immediate surroundings.
  • The spell allows the mage to know the movements of the targeted object, no matter where it goes within their sensory range.
  • If the mage has Space 2, they can cast the spell sympathetically to track the item anywhere.
  • The tracking effect only applies within the mage's sensory range.

name: Omnivision
description:
• The mage can perceive 360 degrees around themselves.
  • The spell extends their vision, allowing them to have "eyes" on the back and sides of their head.
  • With a reflexive Wits + Composure roll, the mage can perceive in 360 degrees as long as they can see their surroundings.
  • The spell makes it difficult to surprise the mage from behind, requiring the person to be well camouflaged and the mage to be heavily distracted.

name: Angle Vision
description: The mage can shift their vision to see around corners, or adjust their field of vision to see around objects.

name: Spatial Awareness
description:
• The mage gains Mage Sight, allowing them to detect spatial distortions and manipulations.
  • Successes in the scrutiny reveal clues about various aspects of the investigated resonance.
  • The Storyteller should make the rolls, sharing information each time a success is rolled.
  • The analysis can yield useful information even if the scrutiny is abandoned before completion.
  • Suggested equipment, such as crystals or gems, can enhance the appearance of resonance.
  • The density of the subject affects the dice pool with corresponding modifiers.

name: Correspondence
description:
• The mage can analyze the connections between things, people, and places to determine their degree of sympathetic connection.
  • This spell provides useful information to the caster who intends to affect a subject through someone or something to whom or to which the target is emotionally bound.
  • The strength of the bond can modify the sense, potentially providing bonuses for strong bonds or penalties for weak ones.
  • If the sympathetic bond has been concealed, the successes of this spell must exceed the Potency of the disguise spell used to hide the bond.
  • This spell requires the target to be within sensory range unless Advanced Factors are used and rolled for accordingly.
  • The caster must be in full concentration to perform this spell.

name: Spatial Map
description:
• The mage gains a mental spatial map that constantly updates her on the changing topography of her surroundings.
  • This spell helps the mage to offset or eliminate penalties to her ranged attack dice pool in the following turn.
  • Each success on the casting roll eliminates one penalty die, allowing the mage to overcome opponents' concealment or other spatially based conditions.
  • The spell allows a temporarily or permanently blinded mage to perceive her immediate surroundings with acuteness, ignoring blindness penalties when locating or targeting beings or objects.
  • This spell cannot be combined with the Fate 1 Sharpshooters Eye spell.

name: Bestow Spatial Awareness
description:
• The mage can cast the Spatial Awareness spell on another mage or supernatural being.
  • If cast on a Sleeper, it immediately invokes Disbelief, even if the spell's Duration is less than one scene.
  • If the target is unwilling, they can resist with a contested Resolve + Gnosis roll.
  • The effect of the spell lasts for one hour.

name: Follow Through
description:
• The mage can use this spell to step through a nearby spatial doorway to its point of destination.
  • The mage can only follow the spatial doorway to its original terminus, with no choice of destination.
  • The mage suffers penalties based on distance, similar to scrying.
  • The number of successes determines the Duration factor of the spell, which must equal or exceed the time elapsed since the door was opened.

name: Ward
description:
• The spell creates a barrier that prevents the passage of other Space spells and protects a specific area.
  • A simple success protects an area of five square yards and gives the Ward a Potency of 1. Additional successes increase the Potency.
  • Space-based spells attempting to breach the Ward must exceed its Potency with their own Potency.
  • Each time a spell breaches the Ward, it erodes the Ward's Potency by one point.
  • The Ward can be reinforced by casting successive Ward spells, adding their excess Potency to repair damage and improve defenses.
  • The Space 3 Ban spell allows the addition of Bans to the Wards, preventing certain phenomena from entering.

name: Astral Beacon
description:
• Mages use this spell to mark locations in Astral Space for easy navigation.
  • The caster marks the location with a specific emotional "signature."
  • The target number depends on the depth of the Astral plane: Oneiros (1 success), Another person's Oneiros (2 successes), Temenos (5 successes), Dreamtime (7 successes).
  • Once the emotional signature is transmitted to another individual using a Mind spell, they can travel to the desired Astral location.
  • The Astral traveler can instantly reach the marked location after reaching the correct plane, unless access is barred by Astral entities or other mages.
  • If the Astral location disappears, such as in dreams, the spell ends.

name: Untouchable
description:
• The mage can perform intuitive tweaks on the fabric of space to avoid hostile attention.
  • The mage gains one point of armor per dot in the Space Arcanum.
  • By spending one Mana, the Duration can be extended to one day.
  • Successes are used to combat attempts to dispel the shield.
  • The magical armor applies against attempts to grapple the caster but does not protect against overpowering or damage once grappled.

name: Track Projectile
description:
• Once the spell is active, any object that's thrown, fired, dropped, or otherwise propelled within the mage's sensory range is subject to the spell
  • To determine an object's path, the mage must have knowledge of where it was at some point during its course
  • A brief glimpse of the object as it whizzed past is sufficient
  • Alternatively, if the mage can see the object where it landed, he can extrapolate its path back to its origin even if he never saw the object in motion
  • The spell can recreate the trail of objects that bounced or ricocheted during their travel
  • However, the spell cannot track an entity that moves under its own power

name: Locate Source
description:
• The mage can determine the precise location where an object was made or an individual was born or died
  • Other effects are possible depending on conjunctional Arcana
  • The caster uses this spell and one or more maps to determine the location of the birth, death, creation, or enchanting of the target
  • Each success allows the character to more precisely pinpoint the exact location
otherArcana: Matter 1 or Prime 1 or Death 1 or Life 1

name: Moving Target
description:
• This spell allows the caster to locate and track a person or object to whom they have a sympathetic connection.
  • The spell can trace the past movements of the target, and with Time 3, it can also predict their future movements.
  • If Prime is included in the spell, it reveals when and where the target has used or been associated with magic.
  • When cast as an extended action, the caster typically uses a map to track the target's movements.
  • When cast as an instant spell, the caster can visualize a map and the target's movements will appear on it.
  • This spell only tracks the target's location and movements, it does not provide information about their activities. To observe the target's actions, the caster needs to cast the Space 2 "Scrying" spell.
rotePool: Perception + Investigation + Time vs Composure + Gnosis

name: Apportation
description:
• This spell allows the mage to move an object, creature, or energy source to or from a remotely viewed location.
  • The mage can draw an item or creature through a scrying window to their current location, or send them from their location to the other location.
  • The use of this spell with other Arcana (Forces, Matter, or Life) determines the type of subject that can be moved.
  • The number of successes determines the size of the subject that can be moved, up to the mage's Space dots as the maximum limit.
  • This spell affects only base or median creatures, and higher life forms require a Portal spell for teleportation.
  • The affected subjects can contest the mage's control over them.
  • Note that using this spell in a way that causes objects to appear or disappear without a plausible explanation is considered vulgar.
rotePool: Dexterity + Investigation or Occult + Space vs. Composure

name: Scrying
description:
• This spell allows the mage to remotely view a location, using all of their senses to see, hear, smell, and even touch things in that location.
  • The spellcasting roll is influenced by the mage's sympathetic connection to the target location.
  • The spell has a transitory Duration, but with Space ●●●, the mage can cast it with a prolonged Duration.
  • Advanced prolonged Duration factors can be used with Space ●●●●.
  • If the mage touches someone through the scrying window, that person may have a chance to notice the touch through a Wits + Composure roll.
  • Combining this spell with other Space spells like Apportation allows the mage to affect objects through the scrying window.
  • When cast conjunctionally with Spirit ●●, the mage can scry across the Gauntlet.

name: Conceal Sympathy
description:
• This spell allows the mage to conceal any sympathetic connections they have to people, places, or things.
  • Each success on the casting roll decreases the apparent sympathetic connection the mage has to a single person, place, or thing.
  • For example, if the mage has an Intimate connection to a cabal-mate, with three successes, they can make that connection appear to be merely an Encountered connection.
  • The true connection remains unaffected, but it only appears to be more distant to observers who can perceive it, such as through the Correspondence spell.

name: Intrusion Warning
description:
• This spell creates a sensitivity that alerts the mage whenever something passes into or out of its area of effect.
  • The mage will be alerted by a slight tingling, pressure behind the eyes, synesthesia, or other minute impulses when something passes through the spell's invisible barrier.
  • The area affected by the spell ranges from a one-yard radius with one success to a 16-yard radius with five successes.
  • The mage can exempt certain things from triggering the alert by declaring them exempt at the time of casting.
  • The exempted things can be general (e.g., insects and rodents) or specific (e.g., one-armed humanoids or the mage's friend Robert).
  • The spell cannot differentiate based on anything other than normal sensory input.
  • The spell does not provide information about what passed the boundary, only that the spell has been breached.

name: Instill Elusiveness
description:
• The mage enchants an item to teleport to a new location within its range of movement when touched by an unauthorized user.
  • If there's a hidden or inaccessible location within the item's range, it teleports there. Otherwise, it moves as far away as possible without rematerializing within a solid object.
  • The item may move in a random direction or make a series of consistent hops in the same direction.
  • The range of movement depends on the Mana spent on the original enchantment.
  • The more Mana spent, the greater the range of movement:
  • The target number is increased by five successes per point of Mana spent.
  • The transportation effect invokes Disbelief in Sleeper witnesses.

name: Portal
description:
• This spell creates a spatial warp that allows the caster (and others) to instantly move from one point in Creation to another without traversing the space in between.
  • The target number for the spell is determined by the caster's sympathetic connection to the destination.
  • The number of successes determines the size of the portal and how many people can pass through it per turn.
  • The entrance and exit of the portal can be placed anywhere that allows a person of Size 5 or less to enter or exit in a single turn.
  • The spell can be cast with a prolonged Duration at Space ●●●●, and as an instant action at Space ●●●●●.
  • When cast conjunctionally with Spirit ●●●●, the portal can lead to locations on the other side of the Gauntlet.

name: New Threads
description:
• This spell allows the mage to create a sympathetic connection between the target and a person, place, or thing.
  • Each success on the casting roll creates one degree of sympathetic connection, as outlined in the chart on pages 114-115.
  • The degree of connection can be increased, such as turning an Encountered connection into an Intimate connection, with additional successes.
  • The spell does not change the normal mental and social relationship between the target and the connected person, place, or thing, but it establishes a mystical connection that can be utilized through Space magic.
  • Living creatures unconsciously resist this spell with their Composure.
rotePool: Manipulation or Composure + Occult + Space - Composure

name: Ban
description:
• This spell allows the mage to add a Ban to a pre-existing Ward.
  • By combining the spell with the appropriate dot of the governing Arcanum (such as Forces for fire or Life for insects), the Ban can prevent a specific phenomenon from entering the warded area.
  • The subject of the Ban can be general or specific, ranging from broad categories like "all energy" to specific objects or creatures.
  • The specificity of the Ban may affect the penalty or difficulty of the spell, with more specific Bans potentially having no penalty.
  • This spell is an exception to the normal spell-control rules, allowing the mage to modify an existing Ward.

name: Interpose
description:
• Upon successfully casting this spell (which need not be cast on the mage's Initiative, but which does use up her action for the turn), the mage may interpose herself between any person within a number of yards equal to her Speed and an incoming attack aimed at that person
  • The attack is resolved against the caster, and successes on the attack roll are applied to the caster, rather than the intended target
  • Immediately after the attack is resolved, the caster is automatically returned to her original position, now suffering from whatever injuries she might have sustained

name: Avoidance Tactics
description:
• The mage can now cast the Untouchable spell on others
  • The target gains one point of armor per dot the caster possesses in the Space Arcanum
  • By spending one Mana, the Duration can be made to last for one day

name: Repel
description:
• The mage combines this spell with an Arcanum of appropriate level to control the phenomenon she wishes to ban
  • As long as the mage concentrates on the spell, the target of the "Repel" rote may not enter a one-yard radius "bubble" around the caster
  • This rote was designed to provide temporary relief from a simple phenomenon (such as falling rock, fire, or hail)
  • Choosing a more complex phenomenon can impose up to a -3 penalty to the casting roll depending on the specificity of the target phenomenon

name: Ranged Blow
description:
• The mage can make ranged Brawl or Weaponry attacks against targets within sensory range.
  • One Mana must be spent by the caster for each attack.
  • These attacks have all the benefits of a ranged attack (the target does not get their Defense).
  • These attacks also have the drawbacks associated with ranged attacks.

name: Multispatial Perception
description:
• The mage can scry multiple locations simultaneously.
  • One location can be scryed per success.
  • The mage catches only a glance at each location.
  • If they concentrate on details at one location, they notice less of what’s going on at others (-2 dice penalty on perception rolls).
  • The mage uses their weakest sympathetic connection when casting this spell.
  • If focusing on more than one location, the Mind 1 One Mind, Two Thoughts or Mind 3 Multi-Tasking spell is required.

name: Destroy the Threads
description:
• The mage destroys a sympathetic connection.
  • Each success destroys one degree of sympathetic connection for a single person, place, or thing.
  • The spell erodes the connection used for sympathetic magic, but doesn't affect mental or social feelings.
  • Living creatures resist the spell's attempts to alter their connections with their Composure.
  • The connections can be re-established over time through physical contact or repeated mental/emotional association.

name: Double Shape
description:
• The mage merges two objects into one, with one existing in the Material Realm and the other in a pocket dimension.
  • As an instant action, the item's owner can switch between the two objects.
  • Both objects benefit equally from any further curses, defenses, or enhancements woven into the combined device.
  • Additional castings of the spell allow for more items to be added to the mix.
  • Switching objects between forms evokes Disbelief in Sleeper witnesses.

name: Expanded Volume
description: Increase volume of size 3 or smaller container by the original container's volume per success.

name: Instill Homing Instinct
description:
• The spell enchants an item to return to its owner's possession even when its location is unknown.
  • The item moves through a gateway in space using the Apportation effect.
  • The Apportation effect is triggered after a specific period of time determined by the spell's Potency.
  • Sleepers who witness the Apportation effect may experience Disbelief.

name: Pocket Realm
description:
• The mage creates a pocket universe known as a Pocket Realm.
  • The size of the Pocket Realm is determined by the number of successes, with additional targets increasing its size.
  • The Pocket Realm lacks features, dimensions, energy, or boundaries, appearing gray and lifeless.
  • The mage can breathe within the Pocket Realm for a limited time, but can use Matter or Life Arcanum to sustain life.
  • The mage has a sympathetic connection to their own Pocket Realm, becoming Intimate after spending at least 24 hours inside it.
  • The mage can open portals or teleport into and out of the Pocket Realm.
  • If the spell expires while the mage is still inside, they appear in the same space as before with a Knockdown effect.
  • If items were placed in the Pocket Realm using the Safe Keeping spell, they are ejected when the spell expires and appear in their original space.

name: Safe Keeping
description:
• The mage can place an item into his Pocket Realm for safekeeping.
  • The item's size must not exceed the size of the Pocket Realm.
  • The Pocket Realm must already exist or be cast in combination with this spell.
  • The effect of the spell is lasting until the Pocket Realm expires.
  • If the Pocket Realm spell expires, the item reappears in space where it was before and causes Knockdown to anyone in that space.

name: Shatter Space
description:
• The spell divides an area into cells that are not geographically contiguous.
  • Each success increases the area affected by the spell.
  • The caster can create one division per dot of Intelligence.
  • The spell does not cut objects or living things into pieces.
  • Targets can move between cells randomly, even if they are not geographically connected.
  • The orientation of cells is randomly shifted, affecting the movement of targets.
  • The Storyteller determines the destination of each cell based on the course of the story.

name: Teleportation
description:
• The mage can teleport to a desired location without physically moving.
  • Prior scrying of the destination is recommended, but not always necessary.
  • The mage needs a sympathetic connection to the destination.
  • A weaker sympathetic connection incurs penalties to the spellcasting roll.
  • The mage can teleport himself, his familiar, and carried items.
  • The size of objects determines the required number of additional successes.
  • Casting the spell with Spirit ●●●● allows teleportation across the Gauntlet.

name: Suspension
description:
• The mage creates invisible spatial strands to imprison a target.
  • The subject is unable to leave the confined area until the spell expires or the mage releases them.
  • The size of the confinement area is determined by the number of successes.
  • The subject can attempt to escape the strands with Dexterity + Athletics rolls.
  • Mages with Space 4 can use the Teleportation spell to instantly escape the strands.
  • In conjunction with Death 2 or Spirit 2, the spell can affect ghosts or spirits.
  • With Space 4, the spell can have a prolonged Duration.

name: Portal Key
description:
• The mage can attune a portal to an activation trigger.
  • The trigger can be a word, phrase, gesture, or other specific condition.
  • Anyone who performs the trigger can open and use the portal.
  • The mage can also use the spell to specify who can pass through the portal (Portal Key).
  • The spell can be cast on a pre-existing portal or combined with the creation of a new portal.

name: Co-Location
description:
• The mage creates multiple duplicates of themselves.
  • The duplicates are insubstantial and perform the same tasks simultaneously.
  • The mage can exist in multiple locations simultaneously (one per success).
  • The mage can choose which location to physically inhabit from turn to turn.
  • Only the real self can be affected by attacks; duplicates have no substance.
  • The mage uses their weakest sympathetic connection when casting the spell.
  • Using the Mind 3 Multi-Tasking spell, the duplicates can say or do different things.
  • The mage can only interact with the location they are physically in, but can perceive what goes on in each duplicate's immediate surroundings.
  • With Space 5, the spell can have a prolonged Duration.

name: Shrink/Expand
description:
• The mage can decrease or increase a target's Size by one point per success.
  • The minimum Size is Size 1 when shrinking.
  • When expanding, the maximum additional Size points are equal to the mage's Gnosis.
  • A target's species factor is partially based on Size and metabolism.
  • Affecting a base life form requires Life ●●, a median life form Life ●●●, and a human being Life ●●●●.
  • Affecting an object requires Matter ●●.
  • Size changes affect Speed partially. For every increase of two Size points, add one point of Speed. For every decrease of two Size points, subtract one point of Speed.
rotePool: Intelligence + Crafts + Space (objects) or Intelligence + Medicine + Space (living things) || Vulgar

name: Oubliette
description:
• The spell banishes a person into a pocket of looped space, where they see themselves reflected in various states of disarray.
  • The victim hears their own voice screaming at them and their own desperate thoughts echoing across space and time.
  • The caster makes an extended roll every 10 minutes, contested by the victim's Composure + Gnosis.
  • If the caster's successes exceed the target's successes, the target loses one Willpower point for each excess success.
  • If the victim reaches zero Willpower points, they suffer a severe derangement and return to normal space/time as a gibbering wreck.
  • After returning from the imprisonment, the victim truthfully answers any questions from the spell's caster.
  • If the victim successfully contests a roll made for the mage, they return to mental reality.

name: Dimensional Axis
description:
• The mage performs complex co-location, causing multiple locations to exist in the same space.
  • Onlookers may perceive optical illusions or be confused by the overlapping spaces.
  • The mage can make the stacked locations interact, potentially causing disastrous effects.
  • The target number is one success per overlapping location.
  • Navigating and interacting with the stacked locations can be confusing.
  • Sleeper Disbelief is invoked, as the scene defies normal perception.
  • The mage can extend the spell's Duration using advanced prolonged factors.

name: Labyrinth
description:
• The mage can mutate dimensional axes, distorting space in ways that defy the senses.
  • Complex manipulations of space, such as causing all paths to lead to a specific location, incur penalties.
  • The mage can sculpt bizarre changes to place and distance, defying normal perception.
  • Creating paths that lead to unexpected destinations or isolating locations can induce fear and confusion.
  • The use of this spell is vulgar and can potentially induce insanity in those affected.
  • Subjects may need to make Resolve + Composure rolls to remain calm and rational.

name: Manifold Presence
description:
• The mage can exist in multiple places at once, physically manifesting in different locations.
  • In the Life ●●●● version, the duplicates are substantial extensions of the mage's physical presence.
  • When one duplicate is wounded, all duplicates feel pain and suffer Health damage.
  • Adding the Mind Arcanum allows for multitasking, where duplicates can perform different actions.
  • In the Life ●●●●● version, distinct clones are created, each with their own Health and Defense.
  • Equipment carried by the duplicates can be made substantial with the addition of Matter ●●●●●.
  • The casting mage does not suffer wounds unless directly attacked.
  • The weakest sympathetic connection is used when casting the spell.

name: Worlds Collide
description:
• The mage can co-locate multiple people or objects, causing them to physically interact.
  • Superimposed objects or people collide and destroy each other's molecular lattices.
  • Contested resistance rolls determine if the co-location is successful.
  • Each success inflicts one point of aggravated damage.
  • Once the targets contact each other, they are immediately repulsed.
  • Targets do not remain fused together.
rotePool: Resolve + Investigation + Space vs. Stamina + Gnosis

name: Hide Space
description:
• The mage can create a hidden sanctum that is inaccessible to ordinary people.
  • The sanctum exists within a complex network of twisted paths, making it difficult to reach.
  • Visitors must navigate specific routes and avoid wrong turns to reach the destination.
  • Attempting to find the hidden site requires extended Intelligence + Investigation or Survival rolls.
  • A failure forces the seeker to start over, while a dramatic failure gets them lost within the tangle of space.
  • The caster can extend the spell's duration using advanced prolonged factors.

name: Phased Strike
description:
• The mage can disregard an enemy's physical armor with this spell.
  • The spell only works if the mage is wielding a weapon made of inert matter.
  • The spell has no effect on armor granted by supernatural means or spells of Shielding.
  • The required level of Matter Arcanum depends on the material of the weapon and armor.
  • For mundane non-precious materials, Matter 3 is used. For mundane precious materials, Matter 4 is used. For extraordinary materials, Matter 5 is used.
  • Enhanced or Imbued Items default to their actual material, while Artifacts are considered extraordinary.

name: Otherworldly Instrument
description:
• The mage shapes ectoplasm or ephemera into simple forms that can be interacted with by ghosts and spirits.
  • The created forms can be basic tools, such as levers, hammers, or clubs, for use by spirits or ghosts.
  • The equipment bonus of the created item is determined by the spell's Potency, up to a maximum of the caster's Death, Spirit, or Gnosis (whichever is lowest).
  • The item can only be used by a ghost or spirit, unless the mage has other magic that allows interaction with such constructs.

name: Counterspell (Spirit)
description:
• The mage creates Pattern interference to weaken or cancel a Spirit spell.
  • Mage Sight is required to perceive the attacking spell and counter it.
  • Counterspell can be cast against vulgar spells from mages with higher Initiative.
  • Counterspell can also be used to counter sympathetic spells cast directly at the mage.
  • Successes subtract from the target spell's Potency; if reduced to zero, the spell is canceled.
  • Covert spells require identification before countering, while vulgar spells can be countered immediately.
  • Countering a spell aimed at multiple targets affects all targets.
  • Countering requires at least one dot in an Arcanum used by the attacking spell.

name: Exorcist's Eye
description:
• The mage can detect the presence of a possessing entity within a person.
  • The spell does not provide information about the type of spirit inhabiting the individual.
  • If the spirit has the ability to hide, it can contest the spell's successes with its own successes to remain hidden.

name: Spirit Tongue
description:
• The mage can see, hear, and speak with spirits.
  • The mage can detect the presence of hidden or unseen spirits.
  • Without additional spells, the mage can only converse with Twilight spirits.
  • If the mage wants to communicate with ghosts, they need to use the Death 1 spell.
  • To perceive mental projections in Twilight, the mage needs to include the Mind 1 spell.
  • The spell's successes must exceed the Potency of any power used to conceal the spirit.

name: Coaxing the Spirits
description:
• The mage can communicate with a sleeping spirit within a material object.
  • The spirit grants its power to aid the mage in using the object more effectively.
  • Each success provides a +1 dice bonus on a single roll within the spell's Duration.
  • The bonus applies to actions influenced by the object's inherent capabilities.
  • Actions unrelated to the object's nature are not affected by the bonus.

name: Gremlins
description:
• The mage can subtly influence a sleeping spirit within a material object to cause it to malfunction at a critical moment.
  • The mage must touch the object or use Spirit 2 to cast the spell at range.
  • Each success imposes a -1 penalty on a single roll to use the targeted object within the spell's scene-long Duration.
  • The penalty applies to actions influenced by the object's inherent capabilities, not the user's skills.
  • The spell is more effective on objects with complex or moving parts.

name: Second Sight
description:
• The mage gains Mage Sight, allowing them to determine the Strength of the local Gauntlet.
  • Successes in the scrutiny reveal clues about various aspects of the investigated resonance.
  • The Storyteller should make the rolls, sharing information each time a success is rolled.
  • The analysis can yield useful information even if the scrutiny is abandoned before completion.
  • Suggested equipment, such as crystals or gems, can enhance the appearance of resonance.
  • The density of the subject affects the dice pool with corresponding modifiers.

name: Peer Across the Gauntlet
description:
• The mage can look across the Gauntlet into the Shadow Realm or the material realm.
  • During the spell's Duration, the mage can concentrate to take an instant action and glimpse past the Gauntlet.
  • Perception rolls are modified by the Gauntlet's Strength.
  • With Spirit 3, glimpsing across the Gauntlet can be done as a reflexive action without concentration.

name: Place of Power
description:
• The mage can strengthen or weaken the Gauntlet at a Hallow.
  • Each success modifies the local Gauntlet's Strength by one point, within the limit of the Hallow's rating.
  • The Gauntlet's Strength cannot be reduced to zero at this level.

name: Spirit Pact
description:
• The mage engages in a transfer of ephemeral energy with a willing spirit of Rank 3 or higher.
  • The spirit sacrifices a Willpower dot on the mage's behalf.
  • The mage uses the sacrificed Willpower to relinquish control of an indefinite duration spell.
  • The Willpower point cannot be used for any other purpose.
  • The mage must make contact with the spirit before casting the spell; the spell does not call or summon the spirit.
  • The spirit must be willing and the deals are pre-arranged.

name: Spiritual Bulwark
description:
• By means of this spell, the mage reduces the efficacy of undesirable non-attack-based Numina targeting him
  • The willworker subtracts one die per dot she possesses in the Spirit Arcanum from all non-attack-based Numina (such as "Possession" or "Terrify") targeting her
  • By spending one point of Mana, the Duration can be made to last for one day

name: Soul Jar (Spirit)
description:
• Creates a receptacle to contain a soul
  • Any sealable container can be used
  • Enchants the receptacle to prevent the soul from escaping
  • Protects the soul from attacks
  • Soul can flee if the jar is opened or broken

name: Grant the Second Sight
description:
• Similar to Spirit 1 Second Sight, but cast on another mage or supernatural being
  • Invokes Disbelief in Sleepers immediately
  • Target can resist with a contested Resolve + Gnosis roll

name: Read Spirit
description:
• When a mage attempts Read Spirit, the Potency of the casting must exceed the Rank of the spirit for any useful information to be learned
  • Conversely, the more Potent the spell, the more likely it is the spirit will notice the casting
  • If the spell reaches Potency 3 or more, the spirit is allowed a reflexive Finesse roll
  • The spirit requires a simple success on the Finesse roll to sense the attempt to read it
  • A spirit's reaction to such an intrusive act varies from spirit to spirit, but is unlikely to be viewed in a positive manner

name: Gossamer Touch
description:
• Through the casting of this spell, the mage gains the power to physically interact with spirits and spiritual things in the Twilight state, similar to the Death 2 Touch of the Grave spell
  • She can touch spirits and be touched in turn by any nearby spirit
  • However, she cannot affect ghosts or mental projections with this spell
  • Affecting ghosts would require the Death Arcanum, while affecting mental projections would require the Mind Arcanum

name: Ephemeral Shield
description:
• Creates ephemeral armor for physical and ephemeral entity defense
  • Mage gains one point of armor per dot in the Spirit Arcanum
  • Duration can be extended to one day with one Mana
  • Does not protect against grappling or overpower attempts
  • Subtracts armor points from damage inflicted on the mage

name: Lesser Spirit Summons
description:
• Summons a specific or general spirit within sensory range
  • Can summon a nearby Twilight spirit in the material realm or a nearby spirit in the Shadow Realm
  • Summoned spirit responds with as much speed as it can muster
  • Spirit may be called personally, by type, or through a general summons
  • Summoned spirit cannot be commanded or forced to manifest
  • Summoned spirit remains near the mage for the rest of the scene, unless allowed to leave
rotePool: Presence or Intelligence + Persuasion + Spirit vs. Resistance trait

name: Cowing the Spirit
description:
• Each success of Potency assigned to this spell reduces an item's equipment bonus by one, to a minimum of zero
  • All other qualities of the item, however, remain unaffected

name: Analyze Spirit
description:
• This spell allows the mage to both see and analyze a spirit in Twilight
  • A single success on this spell allows the mage to determine a spirit's Rank and most significant Influence
  • It also provides a rough estimate of the spirit's current Essence and general appearance
  • Additional successes provide further information, including knowledge of the spirit's Attributes, additional Influences, and the level of its various Influences
  • With three or more successes, the mage gains knowledge of the spirit's more significant or powerful Numina
  • This spell provides no knowledge about the activities or history of a particular spirit, only its capabilities

name: Ephemeral Wall
description: grant Mage Armor

name: Exorcism
description:
• Allows the mage to exorcise a possessing spirit or haunting ghost
  • Target number is the ghost or spirit's Willpower
  • The ghost or spirit contests with a roll using Power + Resistance
  • Does not work on possessions caused by Awakened spells
  • Cannot remove a spirit from a Spirit-Claimed host
rotePool: Presence + Intimidation + Spirit vs. Power + Resistance

name: Control Spirit
description:
• Allows the mage to force a spirit to perform an action
  • One simple command per success
  • Complex commands require multiple successes
  • If the action is not completed before the Duration expires, the spirit is not obligated to finish it

name: Greater Spirit Summons
description:
• Allows the mage to summon a Shadow Realm spirit
  • Known entities are easier and safer to summon
  • The spirit's rank imposes penalties on the spellcasting roll
  • Summoned spirits may be resentful and enraged
  • Does not provide protection against the summoned spirit
  • Range is the mage's sensory perception, unless extended with Space 2
  • The spirit must travel to the mage unless it has teleportation abilities
  • Duration requires the spirit to remain near the mage unless allowed to leave
rotePool: Presence or Dexterity or Manipulation + Persuasion or Athletics or Expression + Spirit vs. Resistance

name: Harm Spirit
description:
• The mage can damage a manifested or Twilight spirit's Corpus
  • Requires Spirit 4 to attack a spirit across the Gauntlet
  • Dice pool is penalized by the Gauntlet's Strength
  • Inflicts one point of lethal damage per success
  • With Spirit 4, damage can be aggravated with one Mana

name: Restore Corpus (Spirit)
description:
• The mage can heal a manifested or Twilight spirit's Corpus
  • Requires Spirit 4 to heal a spirit across the Gauntlet
  • Dice pool is penalized by the Gauntlet's Strength
  • Restores one Corpus point of damage per success

name: Create Fetish Tattoo
description:
• The mage tattoos their flesh or someone else's with specially prepared ink
  • The ink serves as a housing for a spirit, but does not bind it
  • Tattoo designs require Intelligence + Crafts and Dexterity + Crafts rolls
  • Tattoos are created with the substance to be used in the Create Fetish spell
  • Spirit bound in the tattoo can be called upon as a fetish

name: Restore Lost Soul
description:
• The mage can restore a severed or stolen soul
  • Requires the soul and its original owner, or a sympathetic connection
  • Target number based on the length of time the soul has been gone
  • If the soul is attached to a new body, bindings must be destroyed first
  • The spell's effect is lasting

name: Reaching
description:
• The mage can physically reach through the Gauntlet into the Shadow Realm
  • Allows interaction with beings and objects in the Shadow Realm
  • Enables manipulation of Shadow Realm objects and contact with spirits
  • Can be used to strike beings in the Shadow Realm from a safe distance
  • Can also reach into the material realm from the Shadow Realm

name: Spirit Road
description:
• Creates a road across the Gauntlet between the material realm and the Shadow Realm
  • Allows the mage to cross over to the Shadow Realm and spirits to cross over to the material realm
  • Does not prevent other beings from using the road
  • Target number is equal to the local Gauntlet's Strength
  • Each success widens the road to accommodate more travelers
  • Road remains for one hour
  • Caster cannot control who can use the road
  • Can be cast with prolonged Duration at Spirit 4 or instant action at Spirit 5

name: Otherworldly Armory
description:
• By calling upon a spirit whose aspect aligns with a particular sort of physical endeavor, the mage can draw the entity through the gauntlet and shape it into a material form suitable to the task at hand
  • The spell is subject to normal penalties to bind a spirit, even if one is willing

name: Familiar Pact
description:
• The mage can forge a personal pact with a familiar
  • The target must have purchased the Familiar Merit to cement the bond
  • Such a bond cannot be dispelled
  • Only one familiar may be pacted at a time to the same person
  • A spirit in the Shadow World cannot be targeted by this spell
  • The spirit cannot be forced by magic to accept the familiar bond

name: Spirit Steed
description:
• This spell enables a mage to form a pact with a spirit
  • In this case, a large (Size 7) spirit agrees to serve as the mage's steed for the Duration of the spell, bearing her wherever she needs to go
  • Before casting this spell, the mage must locate or summon an appropriate Twilight spirit
  • The mage must be able to see, touch, and communicate with the spirit
  • In most cases, the mage will require a spirit that can manifest in an embodied form to perform its service
  • Difficulty and number of successes depend on the spirit and the circumstances in which the mage casts the spell

name: Numinous Shield
description:
• Creates a personal ward against spirit powers and Numina
  • Gains armor points equal to the mage's dots in the Spirit Arcanum
  • Duration can be prolonged with Mana, up to one day
  • Works against spirit powers such as Numina, werewolf Gifts, and rituals
  • Requires Mana to activate the shield against incoming powers
  • Allows selective use of the shield to block hostile powers while allowing friendly powers through
  • Can be invested with charges for storing energy
  • Can be used with counterspell to prevent a spirit power from taking effect

name: Rouse Spirit
description:
• Awakens the dormant spirit within an object or place
  • Awakened objects gain sentience and can grow more powerful over time
  • Can affect beings in Twilight or across the Gauntlet
  • Starts as a Rank 1 spirit, but can increase in rank
  • Can be used to affect Twilight beings and use its Numina
  • Acts in accordance with its nature and Influence
  • Extra Duration factors can be added to allow roused spirits to grow in rank

name: Sacramental Chain
description:
• Channels Essence from a spirit, locus, or Medicine Bag
  • One Essence point is channeled per success
  • With Prime ●●●●, can convert Essence into Mana or channel it to another mage or source

name: Goetic Evocation
description:
• Manifests a personal ephemeral demon in Twilight
  • Demon has Rank 1, Power ●●, Finesse ●●, Resistance ●●
  • Additional successes can increase Rank, Attributes, Influence, or Numina
  • Demon can use Influence to manipulate others based on its Vice, derangement, or Flaw
  • Demon follows mage's orders, but can turn against the mage if they engage in their personal Vice, derangement, or Flaw
  • Casting requires mage with Wisdom higher than 4 dots and entails a degeneration roll
  • Demon's form lasts for one hour

name: Create Fetish
description:
• Invites or compels a spirit to inhabit an object and grant its powers as a fetish
  • Target number equals the spirit's Rank
  • Finding a suitable spirit requires research and identification
  • Spirit releases its Numina upon fetish activation and sleeps the rest of the time
  • Activation requires Gnosis + Spirit roll, success allows use for the scene
  • If material object is destroyed, the spirit is released into Twilight
  • Spirit can escape to the Shadow Realm on its own if it has the proper Numina
rotePool: Resolve or Presence + Persuasion + Spirit vs. Resistance

name: Spirit Possession
description:
• Allows a mage to cause a spirit to possess a living creature's body
  • The targeted spirit gains the Possession Numina if it doesn't possess it already
  • Possessed individual can contest control with a Resolve + Composure roll
  • Successes are compared to the spirit's possession roll
  • Possessing spirit retains its own powers but lacks host's paranormal capabilities
  • Forcibly binding a spirit against its will may challenge the mage's Wisdom
rotePool: Presence or Manipulation or Intelligence + Persuasion + Spirit vs. Resistance

name: Spirit Guardian
description:
• Allows a mage to bind a spirit guardian to a person, object, or place
  • Spirit protects the subject to the best of its ability
  • Binding weak spirits is easier but they have fewer powers
  • Binding strong spirits is more difficult but they have more capabilities
  • Target number is one success per Rank of the spirit
  • Indefinite Duration may earn the enmity of an unwilling spirit

name: Essence Gift
description:
• Allows the mage to convert Mana into Essence
  • The converted Essence can be channeled into a spirit
  • The spirit can contest if it doesn't want the Essence
  • Each success allows the conversion of one Mana into Essence
  • If no other source is available, the mage must spend their own Mana

name: Medicine Bag
description:
• The mage can create a Medicine Bag to store Essence
  • Any object can serve as a Medicine Bag
  • Organic materials are best for the bag
  • Plastics and metals impose a -1 dice penalty
  • The bag's capacity is determined by the number of successes
  • The bag does not have Essence until it is placed inside
  • The Sacramental Chain spell can be used to store or retrieve Essence from the bag

name: Road Master
description:
• The mage can control access to the Spirit Roads he creates
  • No spell is required for the mage to have this power
  • The mage can approve who can use his Spirit Roads
  • The mage can also cross the Gauntlet without a Spirit Road
  • Casting this spell allows the mage to "step sideways"
  • One Mana is required to cast the spell
  • The roll is modified by the Gauntlet's Strength

name: Grant Familiar
description:
• The mage can forge a pact with a familiar for another mage
  • Most inexperienced mages obtain familiars through this spell
  • The subject pays the Merit cost
  • This spell uses advanced prolonged Duration factors
  • The familiar bond requires the willingness of both parties

name: Bind Spirit
description:
• The mage can bind a spirit into the material world
  • Binding can be used to confine a spirit to a specific location
  • With Spirit 5, the binding can be indefinite
  • The target number is one success per Rank of the spirit

name: Shape Spirit
description:
• The mage can create or alter a spirit
  • Creating a spirit requires successes to buy Rank, Attributes, Influence, and Numina
  • Altering a spirit requires successes to add or change Attributes
  • The mage's Spirit Arcanum or Gnosis determines the maximum Rank or alteration allowed
  • Familiars cannot be affected by this spell

name: Materialize Spirit
description:
• The mage can cause a spirit to materialize
  • This spell can give physical substance to a spirit that cannot normally incarnate
  • The spell can force a spirit across the Gauntlet and into a manifest form
  • The manifested spirit retains its natural form but appears slightly transparent

name: Shadow Slave
description:
1. The mage can infuse conjured shadows with an animating spirit
  2. The shadows can be bound to the mage's will
  3. Successes are used to grant Physical Attributes, Wits, Skills, and armor to the shadow creation
  4. The shadow creation possesses limited intelligence and is not subject to mind control
  5. The mage can give the shadow creation commands as an instant action

name: Secret Marriage (Spirit)
description:
• The mage installs a willing ghost or spirit in a protohomunculus, granting them a physical body in the Material Realm.
  • The homunculus inherits Physical Attributes and Skills from Construct Homunculus Form.
  • Intelligence and Presence dots of the homunculus are equal to the ghost or spirit's Power dots.
  • Wits and Manipulation dots are equal to the ghost or spirit's Finesse dots, and Resolve and Composure dots are equal to its Resistance dots.
  • Homunculus gains appropriate Mental and Social Skills, Flaws, and derangements as determined by the Storyteller.
  • Supernatural powers related to their discarnate state are unavailable while in homunculus form.
  • This spell is treated as a finishing spell, allowing substitute relinquishment costs for Enchanted Items.
  • Similar to a finishing spell, Secret Marriage cannot be dispelled, only temporarily suppressed.
  • With limited Duration, the ghost or spirit departs the homunculus when the spell expires, leaving an empty form for reuse.

name: Spirit Manse
description:
• The mage creates a sanctum in the Shadow Realm.
  • The target number of successes is based on the volume of the manse.
  • Add one success per point of Durability of the outer wall.
  • Ordinary features require no successes, while exceptional features require one or more successes.
  • The mage can control access to the manse, allowing or denying entry.
  • Duration can be increased using advanced prolonged Duration factors.

name: Spirit Court
description:
• The mage creates a spirit court where she is the ranking "spirit noble."
  • The mage's rank in the court is determined by her Spirit Arcanum or Gnosis.
  • Spirits of lesser rank seek to attach themselves to the mage's court.
  • The mage is treated with respect and honor in the court.
  • The mage can cast spells on court members without the need for the Space Arcanum.
  • Alliances with spirits are null and void when the spell expires.
  • The mage is expected to support, protect, and advise her courtiers.

name: Control Gauntlet
description:
• The mage can manipulate the strength of the Gauntlet.
  • The Gauntlet's strength can be increased or decreased.
  • No Hallow is required for this spell.
  • The local Gauntlet can be made non-existent or highly impermeable.

name: Momentary Flux
description:
• The mage can discern whether an ongoing, upcoming, or recently occurred event will be beneficial or adverse for them.
  • The spell provides a sense of whether the event will be a boon or hindrance to the mage.
  • It does not reveal specific outcomes, only the general outcome of the event.
  • If all options are based on random chance, the mage gains a rough idea of the odds.
  • The spell provides information about the immediate future, but events can still change based on various factors.

name: Temporal Wrinkles
description:
• The mage can sense temporal disturbances.
  • This includes detecting temporal phenomena and distortions.
  • During the spell's Duration, a reflexive Wits + Investigation roll can be made to detect temporal disturbances.
  • The mage can also examine and study the temporal phenomena.

name: Tempus Fugit
description:
• The mage can influence a target's subjective experience of time.
  • Each success allows the mage to add or subtract up to five minutes from the target's internal time clock.
  • The target will feel a strong sense of certainty about the altered time, without the need to check a clock.
  • When the spell expires, the target's sense of time returns to normal, but they may not realize they gained or lost time until they see a clock or other indication of the real time.
  • If the target is a mage with Time 1 or greater, they can make a Wits + Composure roll to sense that they have been affected by Time magic.

name: Counterspell (Time)
description:
• The mage creates Pattern interference to weaken or cancel a Time spell.
  • Mage Sight is required to perceive the attacking spell and counter it.
  • Counterspell can be cast against vulgar spells from mages with higher Initiative.
  • Counterspell can also be used to counter sympathetic spells cast directly at the mage.
  • Successes subtract from the target spell's Potency; if reduced to zero, the spell is canceled.
  • Covert spells require identification before countering, while vulgar spells can be countered immediately.
  • Countering a spell aimed at multiple targets affects all targets.
  • Countering requires at least one dot in an Arcanum used by the attacking spell.

name: Precise Dating
description:
• The mage can determine exactly when an object or living being attained its current form
  • This spell reveals when an object was made, when a raw gemstone was cut or a hunk of ore was mined
  • It also reveals when a person or animal was born or when a body or fragment of bone died

name: Perfect Timing
description:
• The spell allows the mage to assess temporal components in her immediate presence.
  • She gains precise knowledge of the most opportune time to act or speak.
  • Each success grants an additional die on the next roll, except for spellcasting rolls.
  • If the next roll is for a spell, the character does not gain the benefit.

name: Temporal Eddies
description:
• The mage gains Mage Sight, allowing them to detect resonance through its interactions with the timestream and its impact on things, people, and events.
  • Successes in the scrutiny reveal clues about various aspects of the investigated resonance.
  • The Storyteller should make the rolls, sharing information each time a success is rolled.
  • The analysis can yield useful information even if the scrutiny is abandoned before completion.
  • Suggested equipment, such as crystals or gems, can enhance the appearance of resonance.
  • The density of the subject affects the dice pool with corresponding modifiers.
  • The mage has the ability to tell perfect time, with a sense more precise than even the most accurate clocks.

name: Time's Mark
description:
1. The mage can determine the age of a living being or object.
  2. The mage stares at the target, no physical contact is required.
  3. For living beings, the spell reveals the time since birth (requires Life 1).
  4. For objects, the spell reveals the time since being worked into its present form (requires Matter 1).
  5. Artificially aged targets or those with altered age require an extended scrutiny action, with success based on Resolve (living beings) or 5 (objects).

name: Temporal Flow
description:
1. Similar to the Time 1 spell "Temporal Eddies".
  2. Can be cast on another mage or supernatural being.
  3. Casting on a Sleeper invokes Disbelief immediately.
  4. Unwilling targets can resist with Resolve + Gnosis roll.
  5. Effect lasts for one hour.

name: Temporal Dodge
description:
• The mage creates a temporal shield for self-protection.
  • Provides armor equal to Time Arcanum dots.
  • Spending Mana extends Duration to one day.
  • Successes used to resist dispelling attempts.
  • Protects against grapples, deducting Defense and Temporal Dodge from opponent's pool.
  • Does not protect against damage once grappled.

name: Glimpsing the Future
description:
• The mage can study the outcome of a personal action in the immediate future.
  • Success grants the ability to roll twice for a single instant action in the following turn.
  • Takes the better result of the two rolls.
  • With Time 3, can be cast reflexively for an instant action in the same turn.

name: Augury
description:
• The mage sees the future in generalities.
  • By declaring a target, they can ask a simple question about that target's future.
  • Examples of proper questions include predicting job interviews, marriages, or potential actions.
  • Improper questions that are too specific or subjective will not yield answers.
  • The Storyteller determines the future based on the knowledge that it can be changed by the knowledge of it.
  • Repeatedly targeting the same person with this spell is limited to once every 24 hours.
  • Attempting to augur the same person sooner results in meaningless echoes of possibilities.

name: Library of Time
description:
• Each success allows the caster to make one Research roll per 15 minutes for extended action research
  • This is instead of the usual 30 minutes per roll

name: Flip of the Coin
description:
• The mage can glance forward and check the outcome of a simple undertaking with only two major variables
  • Examples include heads or tails, or cutting the red wire instead of the green one
  • This sense works only under circumstances where consequences are immediate
  • Even one success accrued in the casting of the spell enables a mage to automatically succeed or fail at an uncontested action with only two possible outcomes and immediate consequences
  • Note that this effect cannot be used in relation to combat, as it is contested and has more variables than simple success or failure

name: Shield of Chronos
description:
• The mage protects himself against Time senses
  • He wards against sensory uses of the Time Arcanum
  • It becomes harder for others to scry upon his past or future
  • The mage becomes invisible to prophecy, divination, and other forms of temporal scrying
  • Unless the caster overcomes the Potency of the occluded mage's spell
  • By spending one Mana, the Duration can be made to last for one day

name: Postcognition
description:
• The mage can experience postcognition, reviewing the past with flawless clarity.
  • They can review the past of their current location, their own past, or the past of an object.
  • To focus on something other than their current location, they need to use Space ●●.
  • Without Space ●●, they can only view the exact spot they were physically present in.
  • The mage declares the time and place they wish to view, with casting dice pool modified by Temporal Sympathy.
  • Each success allows them to view up to one turn of time in the declared place.
  • They view events in real time, but can fast forward and replay within the viewing period.
  • With Time ●●●, they can view one minute of time per success, and with Time ●●●●, 10 minutes per success.
  • The Duration of the spell is concentration, and it expires when the mage stops concentrating.
rotePool: Intelligence or Wits + Investigation or Academics + Time

name: Divination
description:
• The mage can read the future with more specific details than the Augury spell.
  • They must declare a target, and Temporal Sympathy modifies the casting roll.
  • One success allows them to ask one question about the target's future and receive an answer.
  • Additional successes allow follow-up questions for more specific details.
  • Each question provides a vision or image related to the target's future.
  • The same person can only be targeted once every 24 hours.
  • Attempts to divine the same person before 24 hours reveal meaningless echoes of possible actions.
  • If the mage persists, the spell becomes vulgar.

name: Rapid Fire
description:
• Upon successfully casting this spell, the mage may make use of the various autofire options with any sort of ranged weapon
  • This includes weapons that do not normally allow for autofire
  • The mage can use autofire with weapons such as bows or throwing hatchets
  • For firearms and similar weapons, the mage must release three projectiles to use the first stage of autofire
  • For the second stage of autofire, the mage must release 10 projectiles
  • For the third stage of autofire, the mage must release 20 projectiles

name: Temporal Shift
description:
• The mage can protect others using a spell similar to Time 2 Temporal Dodge
  • The target gains one point of armor per dot the caster possesses in the Time Arcanum
  • The effect lasts for one hour, but the Duration can be extended to a day by spending one Mana

name: Acceleration
description:
• The mage can accelerate their personal temporal motion
  • The spell boosts the mage's ability to avoid attacks, Initiative, and Speed
  • The benefits are active in turns where the mage spends one Mana reflexively
  • Each Time dot subtracts one die from attackers' dice pools
  • Each Time dot adds one to the mage's Initiative
  • Each Time dot adds the mage's Speed again to their total Speed rating
  • With Time 4, the mage can cast this spell on others

name: Prophetic Dream
description:
• The spell causes a chosen subject to have a precognitive dream about the future.
  • The subject becomes aware that they are experiencing a dream about the future.
  • The mage does not have control over the content of the dream.
  • The visions in the dream are based on the subject's own circumstances and experiences.
  • Particularly significant future events may be included in the dream, even beyond the subject's personal concerns.
rotePool: Presence + Empathy + Time vs Resolve + Gnosis

name: Review History
description:
• Even a single success allows the mage to gain a general understanding of the events of a person's life or the history of an object
  • Additional successes provide further details and a more complete knowledge of events

name: Shifting Sands
description:
• The mage can rewind time by one turn, allowing them to choose a different approach to a situation.
  • The spell can be cast at any point in the Initiative roster from when the caster performed their action until their place in the roster in the next turn.
  • If the casting roll fails, the mage does not rewind time and spends that turn casting the spell.
  • If the casting roll succeeds, the mage rewinds themselves and can replay their action from the previous turn, changing it as desired.
  • Other characters' actions may also be affected by the mage's replayed turn.
  • The spell cannot undo any effects the mage suffered during the original turn.
  • Participants other than the caster perceive the replayed turn as the first and only time it has happened or will happen.
  • With Time 4, the mage can cast the spell on others, allowing them to alter their actions during the replayed turn.

name: Prophecy
description:
• The mage can gain prescriptive advice on how to alter the future, either to make something come true or to avert a feared or known event.
  • The mage can ask one question per success about a target or event.
  • The spell reads how things might be if a certain action or event occurs.
  • The Destiny Merit of the target imposes penalties on the spellcasting roll, making it more difficult to find an alternate future for someone with a predetermined fate.
  • The mage receives broad and sweeping details about the potential future, rather than specific details.
  • The same target can only be subjected to this spell once every 24 hours.

name: Temporal Pocket
description:
• The mage can enter a personal temporal pocket, where she can take actions without interacting with or being interacted by others.
  • Time within the pocket flows at a different rate than time outside, based on the successes achieved in the casting roll.
  • The mage's subjective time continues to flow at the same rate within the pocket.
  • Successes determine the ratio of time within the pocket to time outside.
  • The maximum target number for the spell is equal to the mage's Gnosis or Time, whichever is higher.
  • The spell only affects the mage and once the duration expires, the pocket ceases to exist and the mage returns to normal time.

name: Temporal Stutter
description:
• The mage can cause a living creature or objects within a defined area to stutter forward in time.
  • Each success in the casting roll allows the affected targets to move forward in time for one turn.
  • Onlookers see the affected targets disappear for several seconds while they lurch forward in time.
  • If someone or something occupies the space of the time-stuttering targets during the intervening turns, a clash occurs when they reappear.
  • The clash is determined by comparing the Size of each person or object sharing the same space.
  • The one with the smallest Size suffers a knockdown effect, while if Sizes are equal, both must contend with a knockdown.

name: Present as Past
description:
• The mage gains absolute clarity in predicting the immediate future.
  • On the turn following a successful casting, players declare their character's actions for that turn.
  • The mage's player does not need to declare their own action and can wait to act at any point within the initiative order.
  • The character gains +1 Defense per spellcasting success against attacks from those affected by the spell.
  • This bonus is in addition to any benefit provided by the Acceleration spell.
rotePool: Intelligence or Presence + Occult + Time vs Composure + Gnosis

name: Chronos' Curse
description:
• The mage can cause an individual to "lag" within the flow of time.
  • The target suffers a -1 penalty to Defense per success on the casting roll.
  • The subject's Speed is halved per success (rounding up), with a minimum of 1.
  • When the victim of this spell makes ranged attacks, their targets gain their Defense against the attacks, even if not at point-blank range.
  • The attacker moves slowly enough that others can anticipate their attack.
rotePool: Manipulation or Wits + Occult + Time - Composure

name: Stop Time
description:
• The mage suspends time around the target.
  • The target's subjective perception shows them existing in one moment and then, instantaneously, another later time.
  • To onlookers, it appears as if the target is perfectly still, even if they are in mid-air.
  • Each success allows the subject to be frozen in time for one turn.
  • The field of suspended time exists immediately around the target.
  • If anyone or anything enters this field and touches the target, the spell is broken and the target is restored to normal time.
rotePool: Intelligence + Occult + Time vs Composure + Gnosis

name: Temporal Lifeline
description:
• The mage forges a temporal connection with the moment of the spell's casting
  • At a later time, the mage can choose to return to that moment
  • Upon returning, the mage has knowledge of what "happened" in the future

name: Future Legacy
description:
• The mage can shunt an object forward in time to keep it out of enemy hands or for other purposes.
  • The number of successes determines how far into the future the object can be sent.
  • The mage can choose any time within the allowed range.
  • The object appears in the future in the same space it occupies in the present, unless Space 2 is used to locate it elsewhere.
  • Once cast, the object cannot be retrieved except at the future time it appears.
  • The spell has a lasting Duration and is considered vulgar.

name: Faerie Glade
description:
• This spell mimics faerie enchantments that alter the flow of time in a specific area.
  • One success affects a five-foot square area, with additional successes increasing the area.
  • The flow of time can be accelerated or decelerated within the pocket.
  • For acceleration, time within the pocket moves faster than time outside.
  • For deceleration, time within the pocket moves slower than time outside.
  • A reflexive and contested Composure + Gnosis roll is required for someone entering the area to avoid being affected by the time flux.

name: Legacy of Power
description:
• Successes in the rote allow the mage to "forward" mana for future use
  • The amount of mana that can be forwarded is up to a maximum of Fate or Prime dots, whichever is less
